I very much LOVED the soundtrack and have been listening to it ever since I had first played a while back.", 'awkward but fun disney crossover from before the series became the insanely weird shit it is now']

Title: Resident Evil 4
Summary:
Resident Evil 4 is a remake of the 2005 original Resident Evil 4 reimagined for 2023 to bring state-of-the-art survival horror. Resident Evil 4 preserves the essence of the original game, while introducing modernized gameplay, a reimagined storyline,
              
              and vividly detailed graphics to make this the latest survival horror game where life and death, terror and catharsis intersect.
Reviews: ['The very first impression of the game is awesome. I was playing on a PC and I was pleased with the optimization, because this year there are a lot of AAA projects that stood out for their optimization. I played the original game for a short time and I can immediately say that the convenience in managing the remake is more to my liking. The graphics were as always on the level. Some locations and weapons have changed. Just like in all parts, the weapons here are very good, how you feel it, how it looks. The complexity, as for me, is much worse than in other parts of Re. Also another of the problems were boss fights, they seemed to me too light and of the same type. There was only one where it was really interesting. The plot is like an ordinary action movie, where the main character saves the world and there is nothing supernatural in it, but it still catches. I advise everyone to play this wonderful game sometime, because there are practically no minuses in it and after passing you will get a lot of fun and dopamine)', 'really good (ignore the "low" rating, my rating scale is very different from everyone else\'s) but there were a few questionable design choices and gripes left unanswered from the original that prevented it from reaching its full potential.', 'Five years from now somebody is going to make a 7 hour video essay on this game titled "Resident Evil 4 Remake: No Thanks Bro" and then everyone will hate it : (', 'CARA ESSE JOGO PQP, ESSE JOGO', 'Que jogo do caralho moleque, o que eu mais amo nele √© como os caras simplesmente largaram m√£o do horror mesmo, o que sinceramente pra mim tornou tudo muito melhor, esse √© provavelmente meu re preferido, tudo nele √© t√£o maravilhoso e t√£o divertido ao mesmo tempo, amo as bossfights, amo os designs, as m√∫sicas s√£o espetaculares, a gameplay √© perfeita, esse jogo simplesmente n√£o tem erros, facilmente meu jogo preferido do ano at√© agora, seja voc√™ f√£ de re ou n√£o recomendo demais jogar isso, foram 26 horas divertidas pra caralho, o jogo me prendeu do come√ßo ao fim, e quando ele come√ßava a me entediar um pouco... BOOM toma explos√£o desgra√ßa monstro bicho gente explodindo foda-se, perfeito demais vtnc, Leon Kennedy que homem perfeito (recomendo jogar no intenso, joguei nele e mesmo assim muitas partes foram tranquilas, mas em outras dificuldades √© bem f√°cil)', 'Imagine doubting CapGod. The madmen did it. They made Resident Evil 4 even better. Reworking the combat to make the knife a vital component is one of the most genius decisions I could think about.']

Title: DmC: Devil May Cry
Summary: DmC: Devil May Cry is the fifth game in the hack-and-slash third-person action series and the first not largely developed by Capcom. This title is a reimagining of the series, with the same protagonist Dante, but set in an alternate universe. The Dante in this game is very different from before, doing away with the trademark white hair and altering the main character as well as the game's tone with a much more Western influence. The gameplay is still largely identical as Dante engages many opponents with a fast fighting style, stringing together combos and hits in quick succession.
Reviews: ['The narrative is laughably bad but the combat is some of the best in the series. It only took me around 7 hours to beat on devil hunter after playing through each game in release order. I almost skipped this game after beating 4 cus i wanted to go straight onto 5, but I would recommend against this. As the game is definitely on the shorter side its really easy to quickly knock it out in one or 2 days, and while this takes place in a completely different world than the other games the combat is so incredibly fun that I\'d recommend playing it just for that. In a way its a game that\'s "So bad its good" and some of the funniest and most out of pocket moments in the franchise come from this. Ninja theory were smoking crack when they made this game and it suprisingly works', 'O jogo sofreu muito hate e com raz√£o, por mudar totalmente a hist√≥ria, mas eu particularmente curti muito o jogo. N√£o sou muito f√£ da saga ent√£o n√£o liguei muito para o aspecto da hist√≥ria em si, mas a gameplay √© espetacularmente gostosa. Recomendo a todos que gostam de Hack N Slash.', 'Everything aside from the gameplay and level design is atrociously terrible.', "i used to think this game was fine until i played Devil May Cry 3 and now it's embarrassing that they thought they had something here. it could've been a 3 star original IP in the same vein as something like Dante's Inferno but attaching it to the Devil May Cry name and failing in every aspect when it comes to stylish character action was certainly a choice.", 'As much as I have to begrudgingly thank this game for giving DMC5 certain ideas that would blossom into great mechanics, enemies, bosses, etc. later on, I also gotta say: fuck this game.', "This game had a rough go of it at release. Its director was flippant with the existing fanbase, and there was a lot of fear that the gameplay would be compromised (despite Itsuno's extremely heavy involvement). The final product was at 30fps unfortunately, but it was nearly intact from DMC3 and DMC4 in terms of what you were actually capable of doing. The frame-rate is actually fine if you were playing it on PC (unlocked even). The only real issue with it is that soft-locks aren't as good as hard-locks in games with crowd-control. The game did well ditching the heavy recycling of stages prevalent in the previous games, and adding platforming-challenges to it in lieu of the awkwardly implement Resident Evil style 'shove silly item into silly hole to open a door' puzzles. The mechanical-execution barrier as lowered, and fans of DMC3/DMC4 were bothered by this."]

Title: Kingdom Hearts III
Summary:
Kingdom Hearts III is the third main installment in the Kingdom Hearts series developed and published by Square Enix. It was initially released January 2019 for the PlayStation 4 and the Xbox One. An expansion, Kingdom Hearts III Re Mind was released in January 2020.
             

              The story takes place after the events of Kingdom Hearts 3D: Dream Drop Distance. It features an older Sora as the main protagonist, who sets forth on a new adventure to search for seven guardians of light in an attempt to stop Xehanort from bringing about a second Keyblade War. Sora is joined by Donald Duck, Goofy, Mickey Mouse, Riku, Kairi, and others. Along the way, Sora travels to many worlds from Disney and Pixar intellectual properties, and cross paths with the real Organization XIII.
             

              Kingdom Hearts III features hack and slash combat reminiscent of Kingdom Hearts II, with elements from later handheld entries, allowing the player to control Sora in a party with Donald, Goofy, and up to two other Disney characters from the various worlds he visits. A major addition compared is the Formchange mechanic, which allows his currently equipped Keyblade to grant him special abilities and change shape. Sora can equip up to three Keyblades at a time, and cycle between them to use his abilities. Another addition is the Attractions mechanic, which occasionally allows Sora to summon and pilot a vehicle inspired by Disney theme park attractions. At certain points throughout the game, the player will be able to control other characters.
Reviews: ['I quite liked this one, but it\'s certainly not without its faults. I was extremely happy to see large open spaces, and mostly fluid transition scenes, as opposed to a myriad of small connected rooms. The action felt great, and the extra power afforded this game via the PS4 made for fantastic visuals and spell effects. The game is probably one of the easiest in the series. The "Disney Ride" attacks did a great job of taking any seriousness and chucking it out the window, and didn\'t feel like they fit in with the rest of the game. The story in this one also isn\'t that great, what with being a) all over the place, and b) going to Akira Toriyama levels of "lol don\'t worry, nobody really dies". Had a good time with this one, but there were more enjoyable ones earlier in the franchise.', "100%, quelques points ou je trouve que c'est dommage mais √ßa reste un de mes jeux pr√©f√©r√©s", 'man.', 'Hard to understand the story.', "Despite all the problems I have with KH3, I won't deny that it's a very fun and entertaining game just like the previous ones. I'm glad that some of the magic that KH1 and KH2 had, but in Spin-off was lost is back here. It's an evolution of what was seen in the PS2/PSP/3DS games thanks to the fact of being developed for a more modern console like the PS4, now the worlds are not simple small rooms interconnected with each other, but now they feel like big areas that we can explore at our leisure thanks to the return of the flow-motion of KH3D, but now improved and a little more balanced so as not to break the levels. Anyway, although the combat is very well polished and could have been the best of the series, due to the approach they wanted to give it, it feels like a super limited version of KH2's combat, which makes me not end up loving it, and as for the story, this was worse than a disappointment, although I admit that it might have been my fault since I tried to take it seriously, honestly it's a shame that the writers didn't put more effort into this section since all the problems/solutions in the plot appear in the most insipid way possible, I think it takes away all the meaning that the scenes and story of this game could have had, but I'll talk more in detail about this later.", 'balenceado e uma obra de arte']

Title: Super Mario Galaxy
Summary: A 3D platformer and first Wii entry in the Super Mario franchise, Super Mario Galaxy sees Mario jump across planets and galaxies with varying items, enemies, geographies and gravity mechanics in order to reach his enemy Bowser, who has attacked the Mushroom Kingdom and hijacked Princess Peach's castle with her inside.
Reviews: ['wouldve been 5 stars if not for the fucking red mario purple coin collection level (the only thing left for completion) that took me for fucking ever.. legitimately over years. but whatever. sound track is really awesome. visuals are awesome. its like, the definitive mario level game tbh, none of the other ones are as fun, especially odyssey.', 'Siento que son muchas las razones por las que este juego es algo √∫nico dentro del mito de un personaje como Mario y es el conseguir evocar el vac√≠o y existencialismo que causa un ambiente como el Espacio sin olvidar que se trata de una Aventura infantil y sin dejar de lado la vibra alegre y divertida de los variados mundos que conforman una galaxia que resguarda el m√°s vivido lamento de una ni√±a que tuvo crecer forzosamente para afrontar un destino lleno de tristeza pero con la bendici√≥n de poder ser una madre.', 'fofo !', 'incr√≠vel', "It's just the goat idk what more I can say", 'bold and expansive, super mario galaxy presents a large-scale platforming experience that slingshots mario into the deepest, darkest depths of space. rather than wallow in its emptiness, we the player are greeted with the warmth of the comet observatory and its family.']

Title: Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy
Summary: Fire up a wild ride across the cosmos with a fresh take on Marvel‚Äôs Guardians of the Galaxy. In this action-adventure game, you are Star-Lord leading the unpredictable Guardians from one explosion of chaos to the next. You got this. Probably.
Reviews: ['Criminally underated, tho could be more polished', "I got maybe 2/3 of my way through it. The characters were fun and the story was okay, but the combat didn't excite me and the fun characters just weren't enough to keep it up.", "Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy > All Guardians of the Galaxy Movies.\n                     \n                     Change my Mind.", "It's a flarking fantastic game. Graphics are good, the story is sublime and combat is captivating. Give it a go, Guardians of the Galaxy is a great game!", 'Chris Pratt is Star-Lord. Shut your goofy irritating ass up bitch!', 'Hab war noch nicht durch aber kenne das ganze game']

Title: Resident Evil 2
Summary: Resident Evil 2 is a sequel to the first Resident Evil title. Like the previous game in the series, Resident Evil 2 is a 3D action-adventure using three-dimensional polygon characters over two-dimensional pre-rendered backgrounds, with the action viewed through a variety of cinematic fixed camera angles in each room. Players can choose to play as one of two possible characters, each goes through the same initial scenario but with differences in the type of weaponry they find and the people they meet along the way.
Reviews:
['Out of the original three
                     
                      Resident Evil
                     
                     games,
                     
                      Resident Evil 2
                     
                     is the most packed to the brim with content. The zapping system helps your playthrough feel unique, and I love how diverse the four main scenarios are. It might be a bit easy, but that makes it the most accessible of these original games, and the easiest to recommend to newcomers.', 'I would say this is Resident Evil with the most Hollywood ending, but I still give that title to RE4. Very consistent in gameplay, I loved the gimmick of the scenarios.', 'Resident Evil 2 is a tried and true classic survival horror title. Coming off from the original Resident Evil, it makes significant improvements in gameplay, storytelling, presentation, and just about everything else to make the streets of Raccoon City ever more terrifying and ever more fun.', "I didn't really dare to beat this game I always requested for help from my older siblings and would rather watch them play this but I remember the entirety of the game because I watched them beat it, the atmosphere this game had is vastly superior to what the Remake had.", 'did some replays
                     
                     im thinkin its goated', 'You once again stepped into the world of survival horror..']

Title: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest
Summary: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest is the sequel to Donkey Kong Country. It was developed by Rare and is one of the best selling Super Nintendo games.
Reviews:
['lindo', '8\10
                     


                      Released on
                     
                     : SneS
                     

                      played on
                     
                     : PC (Mesen)', 'literally the perfect 2D-platformer, i think. the visuals, the level-design, the characters (in terms of what they deliver to the gameplay), is all great. the music is just the cherry on top of the already amazing cake.', 'Too hard for its own good, and Dixie completly outshines Diddy in his own title but damn this game has some fantastic level design. Every level is its own thing and does it well and for a game of that age, thats impressive.', "I prefer the first game by a very slight margin due to a better difficulty balance, but I still think this is a fantastic platformer that manages to expand on what the first game established and add even more. One of the more notable aspects to me is the wide variety of animal buddies as well as the fun bonus rooms each level provides. I'm really glad I got around to finally playing this, easy recommendation.", 'One of the best platformers not only on the super nintendo, but ever']

Title: Shovel Knight
Summary:
Shovel Knight is a sweeping classic action adventure game with awesome gameplay, memorable characters, and an 8-bit retro aesthetic. It's a hot mashup of new and old! You play as the eponymous Shovel Knight, a small knight with a huge quest. Shovel Knight has come to this land with two goals: to defeat the evil Enchantress and quest for his lost beloved. He wields a Shovel Blade: a multipurpose weapon whose techniques have now been lost to the ages. Always honest and helpful, Shovel Knight is a shining example of the code of Shovelry: Slash Mercilessly and Dig Tirelessly!
             

              But, between Shovel Knight and his beloved stands a cadre of villainous knights. These terrible foes, known as The Order of No Quarter, have been dispatched to prevent Shovel Knight from reaching the Enchantress, and will pursue their mission at any cost. If you love games with perfect platforming, beautiful art, infectious music, crazy bosses, humor and levity, and real heart‚Ä¶ Shovel Knight is for you!
Reviews: ['love', 'weirdly destroyed by its sequels being so much better that it makes this game feel slower and less fun. still good', 'My ass sucks at platformers, died too many times at the simplest things, but other than that, yeah this game is great.', 'king', 'Steel thy shovel!', 'Fantastic game that captures the style but not the essence (thank God) of old platformers.']

Title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds
Summary: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds is the first Zelda game made exclusively for the Nintendo 3DS. It is an indirect sequel to A Link to the Past with the same version of Hyrule but with new characters and gameplay elements. Unlike the series' tradition, many areas of the world are accessible from the beginning of the game and the dungeons can be visited in any order. Puzzles are encountered not only in dungeons but also in the open world, a part of them revolves around the game's 3D visual effect. The 3DS touch-screen display shows the world, dungeon or map depending on where you are.
Reviews:
['This is the best top down Zelda, I was compelled to 100% it, and I still want more, such a well rounded game, such fun dungeons and progression, a Must Play!', 'wow i love sports games
                     
                      (
                     
                     the baseball minigame in the legend of zelda: a link between worlds)', 'Best 2D Zelda ever made.', 'Le meilleur zelda "en vue du dessus" et un des meilleurs tout court', "It's a top down Zelda game in the same universe as A Link to the Past and it's a faithful reimagining. The game is smooth and seamless when in combat and has enough unique ways to defeat the enemies in the overworld. The wall-merge mechanic opens up a ton of new ways to explore, solve puzzles, go through dungeons, and collect goods. The item rent-to-own feature is 1000 times better than locking the item in a dungeon and only having it after certain parts of the game. Story is obviously Nintendo-baby level but it doesn't mean it's bad, you're playing the game for the world and puzzles. The exploration is addicting and all the combat scenarios are the most fun you can have in a 2D Zelda game. Goated game, top 3 Zelda game overall.", 'A Zelda game being good? Who would have thought?']

Title: Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne - HD Remaster
Summary: 200X. Everyday life suddenly came to an end. Tokyo is transformed into a world of demons following an anomaly known as the "Conception". This is the story of our protagonist's journey through a changed Tokyo in his new body, and of he and his friends' trials and tribulations as they seek to recreate the world.
Reviews:
["(This short review is tailored towards the HD remaster of Nocturne). Good old Nocturne, though I do believe the eerie, lone, and abstract nature is toned down with the very... VERY bright lighting engine used by this remaster, in some egregious examples I think it looks significantly worse than the PS2's unique lighting which sucks to say. After so many repeated playthroughs on emulator, PS2, emulator again. Replaying this version is.. not a bad way to start.. yet there is merit playing the original. (Plus you don't gotta pay an extra 10 dollars for Dante, thanks Crapcum). Also the music is still bit crushed to hell like in the PS2 version which ironically fit MORE on the PS2, hearing the low quality music with the higher resolution textures and presentation.. weird, very weird and out of place. On the PS2, it fits (and makes sense since it‚Äôs the fucking PS2). Not my preferred method of playing the game but one I would.. somewhat reluctantly recommend out of convenience to those who don't want to deal with emulators. At least you get Raidou without having to mod the base game. Even with manual skill inherent, if you have a method of playing the PS2 version then go with that one, that‚Äôs the way I played the game and still man.. that game gives me such a feeling of dread. I know it sounds like I have nothing positive to say about the remaster, and other than translation improvements to demon names and being able to choose what skills you can inherit which is hardly something that affected the game honestly.. I mean it‚Äôs still Nocturne so.", 'Despite how old this game and how dated some of the mechanics are this is genuinely one of my favorite games of all time. For a game originally released in 2003, this blew me out of the park. A must play in my book but does require a guide to get some of the endings youd want.', 'Should have played the original ps2 release of this game. While I loved the atmosphere, many different demons and characters, and music in this game, the combat does shine above all else. It isnt as hard as everyone says it is but the game lacks a tutorial that teaches you buffs and debuffs stack and the dungeon designs become boring after youve seen the third cave in the game. Enemies often crit you which can make you lose hours of progress thanks to the broken (in a good and bad way) battle system that spits in your face whenever it feels like.', "I went for the true demon ending on normal. The kalpas are pure suffering and the game can just decide it wants to be mean sometimes. Good music and atmosphere. Traveling around the map can be a bit of a pain sometimes. Make sure you get a mod for uncompressed music if you're playing on PC.", 'Me gusta sus facciones y worldbuilding, pero como suele ser con estos juegos el combate s√≥lo se pone interesante durante las peleas con bosses y aqu√≠ los random encounters son excesivos (y aburridos, el 90% del tiempo puedes poner el juego en piloto autom√°tico). El remaster te da otra opci√≥n para grindear, pero necesitas un item para disminuir los random encounters. Con tanto brillo y bloom se ve peor que el original y la versi√≥n de Switch est√° muy mal optimizada.', "This has been one of the most mysterious title I have ever played.
                     
                     The presentation is excellent. The soundtrack stands out solely for its variety and sass. I particularly loved the normal battle theme. Storytelling and themes are the foundation of this title.
                     
                     However, I did not have fun. Gameplay relies on repetition. Dungeons on top of Dungeons, and occasionally some dialogues that move the story forward, pointing to the next location to visit. On the other hand, this may be an aspect that reflects the desolation felt by the characters.
                     
                     I enjoyed this game for the most part, since it was new and felt fresh. But once I learned how to build the party and how to manage resources it started to feel a little too easy. Maybe I'll try SMT5. I would like to see how Atlus improved over the years."]

Title: Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix
Summary: In September 2006, Square Enix announced Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix, featuring new scenes and gameplay elements. Like the first re-release, this version would combine English audio with Japanese text and also use the "Sanctuary" theme song instead of "Passion". New cutscenes, however, used Japanese voice acting, as they mostly featured Organization XIII members from Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories who did not yet have English voice actors; these scenes were later re-dubbed into English for the HD 2.5 Remix release.
Reviews:
['Peak Kingdom Hearts.', 'Em Kingdom Hearts II come√ßamos com um novo protagonista, Roxas.
                     
                     Roxas √© parecido com Sora, ele vive em uma nova cidade chamada twilight town que √© original de Kingdom Hearts, o √∫nico modo de descrever esse jogo √© como um sonho distante, uma memoria, uma nostalgia, algo muito bom que pode voltar ou n√£o.
                     
                     Eu j√° sentia isso no 1, mas nesse jogo se intensificou ainda mais.
                     
                     √â incr√≠vel, cada peda√ßo desse jogo √© feito para ser perfei√ß√£o, desde o seu combate caprichad√≠ssimo at√© a sua hist√≥ria confusa.
                     
                     Esse jogo al√©m de ser uma √≥tima experiencia pelo combate do jogo e sua gameplay, ele tamb√©m passa algo que muitos jogos n√£o passam.
                     
                     A volta da inoc√™ncia da inf√¢ncia, e uma memoria dos momentos bons de volta, amizades, promessas, reencontros e principalmente.
                     
                     Memorias', 'joguei a vers√£o de ps2 quando crian√ßa, e mesmo sendo uma pessoa que esquece f√°cil de tudo, nunca me esqueci do impacto que esse jogo me causou. hist√≥ria linda, sistema de combate genial e uma trilha emocionante, e rejogar ele nessa edi√ß√£o foi uma das sensa√ß√µes mais agrad√°veis que tive nos √∫ltimos anos.', 'Yes', 'Estuans interius, ira vehementi, estuans interius, ira vehementi, SEPHIROT', 'tldr: critical mode saves this, and being waay too combat focused hurts it in many ways and makes it kind of monotonous']

Title: Mega Man X
Summary:
Near the end of his life, Dr. Light succeeds in creating the first of a new series of robots which will change the world. Able to think and make decisions, this new robot holds great danger as well as great possibilities. Fearful of the possible consequences of unleashing his creation on the world, Dr. Light decides to seal him in a capsule and test his systems until they are totally reliable. The future will have to decide his fate...
             

              Released from the capsule by Dr. Cain, "X" is born into the world of the future where the robot rebellions are a thing of the past. But when Dr. Cain tries to implement Dr. Light's designs into a new series of Reploids, something goes hideously wrong. Now the future lies on the brink of destruction and a new Mega Man must emerge to face Sigma and his forces before the human race is wiped from the planet!
Reviews: ['I could probably wax poetic about how this is a perfect example on how to successfully rework an already-solid formula for a new console generation for a good number of paragraphs, but I think "Mega Man X is good" isn\'t a statement controversial or unique enough to warrant that sort of rambling.', 'Probablemente uno de los juegos mas influyentes para los side scroller de plataformas, tiene un dise√±o de niveles que cualquiera envidiar√≠a.', 'I love this game. I love how much detail and care went into it, I love the gameplay mechanics, I love the soundtrack, I love the sound effects, I love beating it again and again and again and again, I just fucking love it man', 'This is the best in the MMX series.\n                     \n                     Fun levels. Fun boss fights. Decent story. Fun subweapons. Fun upgrades, etc.', 'This shit rocks dude (get it? Because rock man and like rocks do you get it?                                                  Please clap)', 'Replaying this bad boy made me appreciate it a whole lot more than before. One of the best Mega Man games due to it having perfect pacing, perfect movement, and perfect boss fights. Sigma has to be one of my favorite final boss fights ever made.']

Title: Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater
Summary: Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater is the prequel to the entire Metal Gear series. Most of the series' defining gameplay elements have been carried over and as before, Snake must use stealth and wits rather than brute force to infiltrate enemy zones and eliminate his major adversaries. Unlike the previous games, this installment takes place in a large outdoor jungle. Snake is able to use camouflage, climb trees, hide in tall grass or wear clothes that make him less noticeable.
Reviews: ['Video games are great because they combine the ability of computer hardware to simulate  and people‚Äôs imaginations/fiction', 'My second favourite game of all time, and pretty much only not my favourite on a technicality. Everything in this game is incredibly executed, one of the most fun and cohesive games ever made.', 'Probably one of the best games ever made.', 'stealth game fun weehaw shoot', 'Completely engrossing, amazing gameplay, and unique mechanics. Another classic', 'bravo kojumbo']

Title: The Evil Within
Summary: The Evil Within is an action survival horror game that draws inspiration from the Resident Evil series with a grimy look with exaggerated gore. The game was directed by Shinji Mikami, the creator of Resident Evil & a former Resident Evil 4 director. You must navigate through the hostile game world with limited resources, this requires to use your wits to survive and correctly manage your resources as you encounters various terrors and dangers throughout the game. The environments may also change without warning in real-time based on your actions, adding more variables to the game.
Reviews: ['https://youtu.be/eIX_sTl3jLI', "J'ai bien aim√© l'endurance du perso quand tu peux courir que 2 secondes et qu'il prend 10 secondes pour reprendre son souffle mdrrrr.\n                     \n                     Vulgaire m√©lange de m√©caniques de Outlast TLOU et Resident Evil.", "This is just a mediocre game. Plain and simple. Nothing here works for me. I love horror games that require exploration of elaborately designed levels, but here, it's just straight corridors with levels strung together. The combat is boring, the artstyle is so painfully 2010s that it hurts my eyes. A lot of people say the sequel is much better but after playing this, I don't even want to try that.", 'Bad physics', 'Can I be....completely honest with you? Like 100%? I went in expecting an underappreciated masterpiece. Obviously, if you\'ve played it- didn\'t get that. This game is....really inconsistent and broken. It\'s full of harmful stereotypes of the mentally ill, which if you know who I am, you know that\'s something I can\'t really abide under any circumstances, so you\'re probably asking: "Why the positive score, then, asshole?"', 'A experi√™ncia de survival horror definitiva, arrisco dizer que, em quest√£o puramente de g√™nero, √© o melhor jogo j√° feito. The Evil Within brinca com seus sentimentos, fazendo-os florescer em sua pele, causando arrepios, medo e desconforto. O jogo v√°rias vezes faz voc√™ se sentir como um impostor em um local que voc√™ deseja ir embora, mas sabe que n√£o pode, pois Sebastian e voc√™ est√£o introduzidos em um ambiente que ambos sabem que n√£o √© seu lugar. A busca pela verdade e pelos amigos te deixam com o peso na consci√™ncia de saber que se tentar fugir, isso ir√° te consumir. Mikami n√£o s√≥ usou sua total criatividade de maneira inteligente, mas tamb√©m interligou sensa√ß√µes humanas com pe√ßas chaves da hist√≥ria.']

Title: Super Mario World
Summary: A 2D platformer and first entry on the SNES in the Super Mario franchise, Super Mario World follows Mario as he attempts to defeat Bowser's underlings and rescue Princess Peach from his clutches. The game features a save system, a less linear world map, an expanded movement arsenal and numerous new items for Mario, alongside new approaches to level design and art direction.
Reviews: ['The best platforming in a mario game', 'Got 96* and still not bored', 'Fait et refait et refait et refait', '√â o Mario 2D definitivo. Tudo aqui expira uma aura t√£o astral, quase sagrada: os pixels, modelos, m√∫sicas, powerups. O jogo gerou um impacto cultural absurdo, respons√°vel por formar boa parte do que entendemos da identidade do maior s√≠mbolo dos games, Mario.', 'Very fun.', 'One of the best games ever made right here. This is perfection in video game form.\n                     \n                     The ROM hacks are a blast, too.']

Title: Ghost of Tsushima
Summary: Uncover the hidden wonders of Tsushima in this open-world action adventure. Forge a new path and wage an unconventional war for the freedom of Tsushima. Challenge opponents with your katana, master the bow to eliminate distant threats, develop stealth tactics to ambush enemies in order to win over the mongols.
Reviews: ['This game is to the PS4 that the last of us was to the PS3. a master class of a game that uses the best elements from the generation to create an experience that I cant stop thinking about years later.', 'Will finish this someday', 'Great graphics, animation, environmental effects, and gameplay atmosphere.', 'Excellent in all respects', 'The most overrated game of all time.\n                     \n                     If you want a truly good piece of Samurai media, check out Harakiri, Vagabond, or any Akira Kurosawa film.', 'THAT ENDING OH MY GOD']

Title: Super Mario Bros. 3
Summary: Super Mario Bros. 3, the third entry in the Super Mario Bros. series and Super Mario franchise, sees Mario or Luigi navigate a nonlinear world map containing platforming levels and optional minigames and challenges. The game features more diverse movement options and new items alongside more complex level designs and boss battles.
Reviews: ['I thought the game was super easy with its short levels but it gradually reached the usual ruthless old mario difficulty. Have no encountered frog or hammer suit a single time and i cannot tell you why, i did finish the game with racoon suit on though, the statue ability is a game changer\n                     \n                     overall fun but not my favorite', 'One of the greatest platformers', "I'll have to admit, it's the definitive Mario game. Just too hard for me. I beat it, but it was a tough, frustrating time. Does a good job at presenting Bowser as an actual threat. His extreme military is pretty impressive. Repeat mid bosses kinda sucks, but since it was relatively predictable, so it wasn't all bad. Can't deny the game's quality, but lacks a lot of quality of life features that I'd want in games. I'll always prefer Super Mario World just for that. (As well as World's iconic and beautiful ending credits) Also, I loved Peach's joke at the end of this game. Good stuff!", "Out of the four NES Mario games, this one is easily the best. The other games have aspects that bother me but this one doesn't have too many. The main issues are how long some of the worlds get, which sucks because I don't like a handful, namely the water and ice lands. The dark land is short, but it's more frustrating than fun. The rest of the game is still good, the dark land is the only one I truly don't like. The new power ups add so much more to the typical Mario formula that really paves the way to future games. Overall, I'd say this game is definitely worth checking out to see how the games evolve over time.", 'I BELIEVE IN FROG SUIT SUPREMACY', 'Come on - it‚Äôs Mario 3!']

Title: Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice
Summary:
Enter a dark and brutal new gameplay experience from the creators of Bloodborne and the Dark Souls series. Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice is an intense, third-person, action-adventure set against the bloody backdrop of 14th-century Japan. Step into the role of a disgraced warrior brought back from the brink of death whose mission is to rescue his master and exact revenge on his arch nemesis.
             

              Take Revenge. Restore Your Honor. Kill Ingeniously.
Reviews:
["Sekiro is the first game in a while, which I kept playing not for the story, but the gameplay.
                     
                     Don't get me wrong, the writing in Sekiro is good, but the main draw is the battles. I struggle to think of any other game   (Metal Gear Rising, maybe?) where parrying is as satisfying as in Sekiro. Deflecting, countering, dodging in rhythm turns almost every single fight in the game into a duel, and this feeling elevates even more during boss battles.
                     
                     The best part of enemies in Sekiro, is that most of them aren't some huge eldritch abominations. You fight other samurai and shinobi, often roughly the same size as you. Samurai use techniques similar to yours, shinobi use tools that you may also have. This makes every battle feel as the true test of skill: challenging, but never unfair. Ultimately it is exactly that feel of challenge that made me dive into NG+ immediately after first clear.
                     
                     I've yet to try most other games made by FromSoft, but I can't imagine liking them more than this one. After Sekiro, I really can't imagine myself coming back to Bloodborne.", 'Hardest game ever. (KATANAAAAA YEAAH)', 'This game was a roller coaster of emotions, excitement, and wonder at the fantastic world to anger and frustration with new enemies and patterns to learn then to happiness and relief as I cleared the bosses that caused me some grief. This game is one of from software finest and has little no exploits so the only way of completing this game is to get good. While it is a challenging difficulty curve, once you get to the peak of skill the game becomes one of the most satisfying and replayable experiences in recent years.... Just get ready to hurt for your first few hours.', 'PEAK PEAK PEAK', 'Legit nothing bad about you', "Assez court dans l'histoire principale mais le gameplay est intuitif et kiffant pour tout fan de FS et de katana"]

Title: Crash Bandicoot
Summary: Crash Bandicoot is the first installment in the Crash Bandicoot series that established Naughty Dog's reputation in the video game industry. Its premises chronicle the creation of the titular Crash, a bandicoot who has been uplifted by the mad scientist Doctor Neo Cortex. The goal of Crash Bandicoot is to traverses several levels in sequence in order to progress. The game is played from a third-person perspective in which the camera trails behind Crash, though some levels showcase forward-scrolling and side-scrolling perspectives. Crash is able to defeat enemies by either jumping on them or using a spinning attack that launches them.
Reviews: ['carlos el topo que gira', "It was my first Crash game and I fell in love with it, unfortunately the game did not age well because I could clearly feel that it wasn't meant to be played with analog sticks, only D-pad which makes some sections frustrating.", "This game is really fun and holds up well for being the very first one in the series and being made in 1996. I never beat it as a kid, but later years I went back and damn it was nice. The bridge levels are bad in that they're linear and your vision is like a little messed up but you can negate it by just walking on the ropes and cheese the levels which is awful.", '!!!', 'Feels like shit to play', 'Dated and horrible level design']

Title: Until Dawn
Summary:
Until Dawn is an interactive drama survival horror video game. It was originally scheduled to be released on the PlayStation 3 and feature PlayStation Move support, but in August 2014, the game was reintroduced as a PlayStation 4 exclusive.
             

              Until Dawn is designed to be played multiple times, as players will miss out on quite a bit of content with a single playthrough. Each will last about nine hours in length and the game mechanics utilize a new in-game system called the "Butterfly Effect" in which any choice of action by the player may cause unforeseen consequences later on. For example, locating a weapon in an earlier chapter may allow the player to pick it up down the line when a chase scene leads back to the same room. Throughout the game, players will make difficult decisions during ethical or moral dilemmas, such as sacrificing one character to save another. The Butterfly Effect system blurs the line between right and wrong decisions and it is possible for players to keep all eight characters alive as well as having all eight of them die, allowing for many different paths and scenarios as well as offering several different endings. Until Dawn has a strict auto-save system to prevent players from reloading a previous save file to an earlier point in the game if they regret an in-game decision they have made. The only way to change the player's choice is to restart the game from the beginning or continue to the end and start a new game. In a developer interview, it has been said that Until Dawn has "hundreds of endings". Different endings have different variations depending on the combination of characters alive at the end of the game.
             

              The gameplay is focused on exploration, quick-time events and discovering clues as well as making decisions. There is an in-game system that will keep track of all of the clues and secrets players have discovered in total, even if there are multiple playthroughs; these clues will allow the player to piece together the mysteries of Blackwood. In terms of the gameplay mechanics and theme, Until Dawn has been noted to be similar to Heavy Rain and Beyond: Two Souls.
             

              Until Dawn was met with a positive critical response upon release, with praise directed at the visuals, choice mechanic, horror elements, music, voice acting and gameplay design. Most of the criticism the game drew was concerning the story, mostly the second half, camera angles, character movements and partially linear plot.

Title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
Summary:
Developed by Kojima Productions and PlatinumGames, Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance takes the renowned Metal Gear franchise into exciting new territory with an all-new action experience. The game seamlessly melds pure action and epic story-telling that surrounds Raiden √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú a child soldier transformed into a half-human, half-cyborg ninja who uses his High Frequency katana blade to cut through any thing that stands in his vengeful path!
             

              A huge success on both Xbox 360 and PlayStation3, Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance comes to PC with all the famed moves and action running within a beautifully-realized HD environment.
             

              This new PC version includes all three DLC missions: Blade Wolf, Jetstream, and VR Missions, in addition to all customized body upgrades for Raiden, including: White Armor, Inferno Armor, Commando Armor, Raiden√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s MGS4 body, and the ever-popular Cyborg Ninja.
             

              "CUTSCENES" option added to the Main Menu. Play any and all cutscenes.
             

              "CODECS" option added to the Main Menu. Play all and any codec conversation scenes.
             

              Menu option added to the CHAPTER Menu enabling user to play only the Boss battles.
             

              "GRAPHIC OPTIONS" added to the OPTIONS Menu. Modify resolution, anti-aliasing, etc.
              
              There is an option reading "ZANGEKI" that will modify the amount of cuts you can make.
Reviews: ['Has flaws, but I liked codec calls, villain banter and music√¢‚Ç¨¬¶. sooo√¢‚Ç¨¬¶', "I'd like to finish this one day, but for now my first impression wasn't amazing.", "Admittedly, for as much as I love this game and will always adore it for having one of the strongest vocal soundtracks ever, this playthrough wasn't my favourite.", 'Decent lore, but most importantly; Raiden', 'RULES OF NATURE', 'My favorite "funny" bad type of game, but god the amount of damage the game does to Raiden is absymal.']

Title: Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
Summary: The story of Cal Kestis continues in Star Wars Jedi: Survivor, a third-person, galaxy-spanning, action-adventure game from Respawn Entertainment, developed in collaboration with Lucasfilm Games. This narratively driven, single-player title picks up five years after the events of Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order and follows Cal‚Äôs increasingly desperate fight as the galaxy descends further into darkness. Pushed to the edges of the galaxy by the Empire, Cal will find himself surrounded by threats new and familiar. As one of the last surviving Jedi Knights, Cal is driven to make a stand during the galaxy‚Äôs darkest times ‚Äî but how far is he willing to go to protect himself, his crew, and the legacy of the Jedi Order?
Reviews:
['Star Wars Jedi: Survivor will go down as one of the finest action-adventure games of recent memory and earns its spot as one of the best AAA Star Wars games.
                     
                     It is filled with heart, joy, sorrow and a resolute respect for the universe it takes place in. Cal Kestis is better fleshed out in this sequel, and the supporting cast are fantastic. As a sequel, Survivor improves upon its predecessor in almost every way. Exploration and level-design are elevated, with worlds that are truly stunning. The combat is refined, rewarding and well realized. The level of customization in this game is truly admirable, from cosmetics to accessibility. This game's greatest flaw, in my eyes, will likely be a transient one. As of the time of this writing, the game does have notable performance issues. On Koboh, the main hub world in which Survivor takes place, performance absolutely chugs in the open world‚Ä¶ screen tearing and jarring fluctuations in frame rate hurt the experience but ultimately the game shines through in face of these issues. There is a certain level of swashbuckling adventure to this game, like one might expect from the Uncharted games. However this is accompanied by the Metroidvania-style roots established by
                     
                      Jedi: Fallen Order
                     
                     and a stellar combat system that outshines any prior attempt at depicting the Jedi power fantasy in the gaming medium.
                     
                      Jedi: Survivor is a special game that admirably carries on one of the best Star Wars stories in the past couple decades.
                     
                     Should Respawn pursue a "
                     
                      Star Wars: Jedi
                     
                     " trilogy, the third game will have gargantuan shoes to fill‚Ä¶ and I will once again be there to greet it, day one.', 'Honestly this game is amazing if it weren‚Äôt for its optimization issues that fucks me over sometimes but overall this is such a huge improvement from Fallen Order and a definite must have nice those issues are fixed and I especially love the new customization stuff you can do to Cal and the new stances were especially fun to play around with that I personally use a lot of the Saber and Blaster and Dual Wield stances for the majority of the game while the Crossguard saber is good for bosses or if you know how to time stuff correctly.', 'ONE OF THE GREATEST STAR WARS GAMES TO DATE!', 'Yes the PC performance is really that bad, but at least everything else is pretty much perfect', 'Star Wars Jedi: Lag Survivor', "This game is so much better than Fallen Order; the story is great, the ending made me tear up, and the gameplay is fun as hell, but it suffers from having the same dookie map as Fallen Order, which made me want to blow up. BUT IT'S A GREAT GAME! PLAY IT!!!!!! It's so good."]

Title: Call of Duty: Black Ops III
Summary: Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 deploys players into a dark, twisted future where a new breed of Black Ops soldier emerges and the lines are blurred between our own humanity and the technology we created to stay ahead, in a world where cutting-edge military robotics define warfare. With three unique game modes: Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies, providing fans with the deepest and most ambitious Call of Duty ever.
Reviews: ['Ta bonito', 'Zombies', 'Zombies is fun, and the only reason I played', 'Meilleur cod avec le 2', 'childhood', 'The zombies mode is the main shine here. Just get it while its on sale, aint no one tryna buy it at 60 bucks.']

Title: The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD
Summary: The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD is a remaster of The Wind Waker with an alternate recreation of the original's art style, several gameplay adjustments, a new lighting engine and higher resolution textures.
Reviews: ['Yeah this game still does it, genuinely Zelda on the ocean done PERFECT! This game is my everything man', 'Pirates and Link are both cool, but it would have been even cooler if Link was a pirate', "I love the great sea, it makes everything feel like a true adventure and it's awesome. The rest is pretty average zelda stuff, what you'd expect from the series, but damn the great sea is such an incredibly fun concept", "The Wind Waker HD might be a game for babies. Lots of hand-holding throughout the game, including in some dungeon puzzles that would otherwise force you to actually engage with the rooms you're in and connect dots (looking at you, Ganon's Tower), quest markers for the main quest, and that extremely annoying gossip stone. The King of Red Lions looks so cool, both as a boat and as a man, but holy hell he needs to stop talking.", "I know a 1/5 seems harsh, but the new visuals where the bloom is so excessive it looks like you're staring at the screen through a smudged window and the conflicting lighting engines that turn models into clay when you approach a light source on top of the chugging frame-rate make this an unacceptable port to me in the moment-to-moment gameplay. It just looks and runs worse than the original too often.", "There was a point in time after I initially completed the 3ds remake of Ocarina of Time when I was fascinated with Zelda and was clamoring for more. However, there was a problem, I was a kid who only got money on a few occasions throughout the year. Because of this inconvenience, it took me a pretty long while before I finally got to purchase most of them, but by that time, the Zelda craze I had was long gone so I didn't get far into playing them. Now that I've finally beaten Wind Waker, all I can say is I wish I played this sooner."]

Title: Fire Emblem: Awakening
Summary:
Armies clash as the world burns. As an inevitable war draws ever closer, you must stand with Chrom and his forces--knights, mages, archers, and more--commanding them against the armies of kingdoms, empires, and the dead themselves.
             

              Plan your strategery. Move your troops on the battlefield, then choose their weapon and attack. Using the new Pair Up and Dual systems, support your attacks with the help of nearby allies and watch their skills and relationships grow.
Reviews: ["I never gave a proper review for this game because i knew it'd be a really long one but I think now at the hour of 1:18AM, i can totally put something down to better express what this game means to me.", "the game that got me into the series. truly a game that's needed.", "DON'T MESS WITH A BUNNY", 'chrom / f!robin support defender', "unfortunately the most important game ive played in my life so far and everytime i think about it it's the most pleasant of thoughts", 'You guys think the devs behind this game could have predicted the things that would come from it? Like the return of the franchise, three characters in Super Smash Bros, and the red angry bird from the hit mobile game going on social media and openly declaring his desire to fuck one of the characters?']

Title: Mass Effect
Summary:
What starts as a routine mission to an agrarian outpost quickly becomes the opening salvo in an epic war. As the newly appointed Executive Officer of the SSV Normandy, you'll assemble and lead an elite squad of heroes into battle after heart-pounding battle. Each decision you make will impact not only your fate, but the destiny of the entire galaxy in the Mass Effect trilogy.
             

              Key Features:
             

              Incredible, interactive storytelling. Create and customize your own character, from Commander Shepard's appearance and skills to a personalized arsenal. Unleash devastating abilities as you command and train. Your decisions will control the outcome of each mission, your relationships with your crew and ultimately the entire war.
             

              An amazing universe to explore. From the massive Citadel to the harsh, radioactive landscape of the Krogan home world ‚Äì the incredible breadth of the Mass Effect universe will blow you away. Travel to the farthest outposts aboard the SSV Normandy, the most technologically advanced ship in the galaxy. You'll follow the clues left by ancient civilizations, discover hidden bases with fantastic new tech and lead your hand-picked crew into explosive alien battles.
             

              Edge-of-your-seat excitement meets strategic combat. Find the perfect combination of squad-mates and weapons for each battle if you want to lead them to victory. Sun-Tzu's advice remains as pertinent in 2183 as it is today ‚Äì know your enemy. You'll need different tactics for a squad of enemies with devastating biotic attacks than a heavily armored Geth Colossus so choose your teams wisely.
Reviews: ['*Played via the Legendary Collection for PS4', "Humanity stands on the edge of galactic politics, begging for a seat at the table as a rogue agent, acting with impunity seeds events in the hopes of eliminating all life in the galaxy. One man/woman, Commander Shepard, acting as the beacon of humanity's virtues, must rise up and assemble a team of the galaxy's finest heroes to not only ensure that mankind has a seat at the table, but that there is a table left to sit at.", "This whole game just feels like a giant tech demo for the NEXT GENERATION of gaming...but it's a good ass lore-filled tech demo that serves as a STEPPING STONE for the masterpiece of a sequel that was to come....", "Mass Effect is about the 3-game experience but I loved this one. Some people say skip it but it's more RPG than FPS adventure and I liked it.", 'Love it. Already wrote a review elsewhere so will have to come back and supplement this one in the future.', "I wish i could fuck that guy's ass"]

Title: Little Nightmares
Summary: Immerse yourself in Little Nightmares, a dark whimsical tale that will confront you with your childhood fears! Help Six escape The Maw ‚Äì a vast, mysterious vessel inhabited by corrupted souls looking for their next meal. As you progress on your journey, explore the most disturbing dollhouse offering a prison to escape from and a playground full of secrets to discover. Reconnect with your inner child to unleash your imagination and find the way out!

Title: Sable
Summary: Sable is a coming-of-age tale of discovery through exploration across a strikingly rendered open world desert. Go on a deeply personal journey across an alien planet while learning its history and discovering Sable‚Äôs place in the world.
Reviews: ["Like a 3D Celeste (climbing and exploration as a metaphor for self-affirmation and self-discovery), but with challenge dial turned way down, and the focus firmly on chill travelling. It's extremely beautiful, the art gets tens across the board. The pacifist, solarpunk, utopian politics of the game show that its heart is in the right place as well. The gaming aspects themselves are where the game fails, since most of them are pretty simplistic and feel like an afterthought, but i really enjoyed exploring the Le Guin-esque story and world, and nailed every single trophy just to see as much of it as possible.", 'Great game completely ruined by probably the worst performance on PS5 and an insane about of glitches. No idea how the devs though this was an acceptable release', 'O meu jogo favoritinho de todos. Title: Crash Bandicoot 4: It's About Time
Summary: Crash Bandicoot 4: It's About Time is the eighth Crash Bandicoot series game, though the fourth chronologically. The game retains the series' core platforming gameplay and adds new elements through the use of the Quantum Masks, who can alter levels and provide means to traverse or overcome obstacles. It also includes additional game modes for replaying levels, and the ability to control five characters, three of whom ‚Äì Cortex, Dingodile, and Tawna ‚Äì have their own unique gameplay and levels.
Reviews: ['Faithful return to the roots. Had a blast playing this, felt like I was back in the early 2000s getting home from summer camp to play The Wrath Of Cortex.', 'Started it. Solid crash game so far, they captured what a crash game was. Makes me want T4B to do Spyro 4.', 'I‚Äôve been playing this for 3 years now and I still wanna kms every time 8/10 experience', 'I loved this game but completing it was a nightmare. Upcoming levels gave me physical anxiety knowing I‚Äôd be stuck bashing my head against that wall until finally I overcame. One of the first games I ever completed in its entirety and somehow spawned the achievement hunting mentality in me, despite all the difficulties I had with it.', "I have no idea how I managed to get this game to 100% completion but I did. Don't do it. Just enjoy the cute visuals and go. Treat it like a car wash. In and out bro", "Don't ever try to bring it to completion"]

Title: Dragon Age: Origins
Summary: Dragon Age: Origins is a third-person role-playing game described as a spiritual successor to Baldur's Gate and Neverwinter Nights franchises. Players create their own character by customizing gender and appearance as well as choosing a race and class. Combat is in real time with the ability to pause at any moment: tactical options include an editor which allows the player to give the AI detailed instructions on how to behave in every possible situation. Although the main storyline is the same for every character created, the game features six unique prologues, two for each race. Dragon Age: Origins received critical acclaim upon release, with praise mostly directed at its story, setting, characters, music and combat system.

Title: Shadow of the Colossus
Summary: An open-world action/adventure game in which a young wanderer, along with a stolen magical sword and his steed companion, trespasses a cursed land, makes a deal with an ancient being to bring a sacrificial victim back to life, and sets off to fulfill his end of the bargain, which involves tracking down and infiltrating the abodes of sixteen colossi and sacrificing them to achieve his goal.
Reviews: ['This is souls combat in an open world with an amazing soundtrack and a list of memorable bosses and a great story to go with it', 'Epic adventure, use what you have to find each colossi', 'Absolutely majestic in scope. Explores the double-edged nature of sacrifices with extreme nuance. Now that you‚Äôve started your journey, can you really go anywhere but forward? A direction you know nothing of? Wish it wasn‚Äôt as clunky and frustrating as it was. Otherwise would be a strong favorite.', 'Almost a perfect game imo, and definitely my favorite', 'everything about this game is perfect besides how rocky and unresponsive the gameplay can be most of the time', 'they were so unbelievably real for this']

Title: Assassin's Creed Origins
Summary:
For the last four years, the team behind Assassin‚Äôs Creed IV Black Flag has been crafting a new beginning for the Assassin‚Äôs Creed franchise.
             

              Set in Ancient Egypt, players will journey to the most mysterious place in history, during a crucial period that will shape the world and give rise to the Assassin‚Äôs Brotherhood. Plunged into a living, systemic and majestic open world, players are going to discover vibrant ecosystems, made of diverse and exotic landscapes that will provide them with infinite opportunities of pure exploration, adventures and challenges.
             

              Powered by a new fight philosophy, Assassin's Creed Originsembraces a brand new RPG direction where players level up, loot, and choose abilities to shape and customize their very own skilled Assassin as they grow in power and expertise while exploring the entire country of Ancient Egypt.

Title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2
Summary: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 is a first-person shooter video game developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 video game consoles and the Microsoft Windows operating system. Officially announced on February 11, 2009, the game was released worldwide on November 10, 2009. It is the sixth installment of the Call of Duty series and the direct sequel to Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare, continuing the same storyline, with Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 set to end the storyline.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne
Summary: In Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne, the player takes on the role of a young boy who is caught up in the apocalypse while visiting his sick teacher, Yuko Takao, with his two classmates Chiaki Hayasaka and Isamu Nitta. The player must survive in the Vortex World with the new powers and capabilities given to the protagonist through Magatama obtained from Lucifer. With these powers, the player is given the opportunity to align themselves with a Reason that decides what the world will become.

Title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Justice for All
Summary: The second game in the popular court room battle series from Japan introduces four new cases featuring new characters, plot twists and gameplay features. Players resume the role of Phoenix Wright, a defense attorney who must prove his client's innocence against the toughest of odds and most ruthless of adversaries. Players must exercise their legal prowess as they collect evidence, examine witnesses, analyses testimonies and seek the truth to ensure that justice prevails.
Reviews: ['Case 4 is the only case I care about in this game. But it is like my favorite case ever so 7/10 nevertheless', 'amo', 'none of the cases really interested me except the last one', 'please replace maya more in the future games', 'This game introduces a new mechanic known as Psyche Locks, in which throughout the investigation segments of the game, some characters are unwilling to talk about certain topics, and you will need to break through that hesitation by presenting these characters with the evidence you have gathered, this mechanic adds a very interesting and engaging layer to the investigation segments as when you see a character with a Psyche Lock or several, there will be this lingering mystery of why they are keeping things a secret until you find the right evidence and break through their unwillingness, which is super cool and satisfying. The rest of the gameplay is still as fun as ever: clicking on the backgrounds, initiating funny dialogue between the characters, the satisfying feeling of presenting the correct evidence in court and slowly uncovering the mystery, all that jazz. All the characters from the first game like Maya and Gumshoe are still as amazing as ever, and the brand new characters they introduced in this entry like the arrogant Franziska Von Karma and the stoic Adrian Andrews are all fantastic as well, creating new and fresh dynamics between the cast and makes the game super engaging. The cases in this game aren‚Äôt bad either (even if there are only 4), like the previous game, the best thing about these cases is that they are always so much more than what they may seem on the surface, so then even if you knew who the killer is, the story still has many interesting mysteries for you to solve. I thought case 3 was actually really fun and case 4 is still one of the best cases in this series, challenging Phoenix Wright‚Äôs value on Justice.', 'Played this game on the switch collection feels like the stories got even better in this one']

Title: Hollow Knight: Voidheart Edition
Summary:

Title: Halo 3
Summary:
Halo 3 is a shooter game where players primarily experience gameplay from a first-person perspective. Much of the gameplay takes place on foot, but also includes segments focused on vehicular combat. The balance of weapons and objects in the game was adjusted to better adhere to the "Golden Triangle of Halo": these are weapons, grenades, and melee attacks, which are available to a player in most situations. Players may dual-wield some weapons, forgoing the use of grenades and melee attacks in favor of the combined firepower of two weapons. Many weapons available in previous installments of the series return with minor cosmetic and power alterations. Unlike previous installments, the player's secondary weapon is visible on their player model, holstered or slung across the player's back.
              
              Halo 3 introduces "support weapons", which are cumbersome two-handed weapons that slow the player, but offer greatly increased firepower in return. In addition to weapons, the game contains a new class of gear called equipment; these items have various effects, ranging from defensive screens to shield regeneration and flares. Only one piece of equipment can be carried at a time. The game's vehicular component has been expanded with new drivable and AI-only vehicles.
Reviews:
["Probably my favorite FPS of all time. Everything about it is just PEAK! Warthog run is one of the best finales to a video game trilogy ever. Not to sound like a boomer, but they really don't make games like this anymore.", 'Three games into this franchise and I finally understand why it is beloved by so many. Halo 3 maintains the fantastic soundtrack, gunplay, variety and pacing which made the previous entry so memorable. However, improved level design, enemy design and some surprising emotional beats in the story help elevate this experience. The final levels in this game are sheer bliss and are among the best I‚Äôve experienced in an FPS campaign. Though there is still some room for improvement with the repetitiveness of facing seemingly endless waves of enemies and the lack of engaging bosses. However, this is still an incredibly satisfying conclusion to the original master chief trilogy, excelling both in its gameplay and story.', "Going to be honest I barely remember this game, but I remember that I played it. It clearly wasn't highly memorable like Halo 2 was to me for some reason.", 'This game is so awesome', "Gameplay: Great.
                     
                     Story: Great
                     
                     Controls: Great
                     
                     Graphics: Great for its time
                     
                     Length: Great. Could have used another chapter or two, but it's alright.", "This is for me the definitive vanilla multiplayer Halo game, It wasn't my childhood game (Yes I missed out a lot) I played it on PC when it got ported and it is single handedly responsible for making me spend hours in the Master chief collection, it might not have the mods Halo: CE had back then but the multiplayer was really fun and balanced."]

Title: Rain World
Summary: Rain World is a survival platformer set in an abandoned industrial environment ravaged by a shattered ecosystem. Bone-crushingly intense rains pound the surface, making life as we know it almost impossible. The creatures in this world hibernate most of the time, but in the few brief dry periods they go out in search of food.

Title: Sonic Adventure 2
Summary: Sonic Adventure 2 is the sequel to Sonic Adventure. It was the final Sonic game for the Dreamcast after Sega discontinued the console. Two new playable characters were introduced, Shadow and Rouge, who would go on to become two of the most recurring characters in the Sonic series. The story features good vs evil: Sonic, Tails and Knuckles attempt to save the world, while Shadow, Doctor Eggman and Rouge attempt to conquer it. The levels are divided into three gameplay styles: fast-paced platforming for Sonic and Shadow, multi-directional shooting for Tails and Eggman, and action-exploration for Knuckles and Rouge.
Reviews: ["Really good but you have to play as tails and eggman to beat it and that's no bueno but everything else is great!", 'I like the Chao garden', 'Frustrating in some places but a recommendation overall.', 'you raised me', "this game is actually pretty groundbreaking in the sense that it's actually a good game, which is something the sonic franchise rarely ever sees, even then it still hasn't aged the best tbh", 'if you didn‚Äôt play this game before you were 15 then you‚Äôll never get it sorry']

Title: Alien: Isolation
Summary: Alien: Isolation is a survival horror game based on the Alien franchise. As Amanda Ripley, daughter of Ellen Ripley, you will navigate through an increasingly volatile world as you find yourself confronted on all sides by a panicked population and an unpredictable Alien. You must scavenge resources, improvise solutions and use your wits, not just to succeed in your mission but to simply stay alive. In addition to the main story mode there's Survivor mode in which the player needs to escape from a specially designed map fulfilling secondary objectives along the way, while being aggressively hunted by the alien. This mode includes online leaderboards.
Reviews: ['The only horror game of its kind that I thoroughly enjoyed, start to finish, 10/10 no notes etc etc; far better than Outlast and similar.', "hands down one of the best Survival Horror games I ever played, unique atmosphere and visual style alongside the clever use of it's gameplay mechanics.", "Alien: Isolation is a horror adventure game set after the main film series. While the plot isn't as strong as other elements of the game, the theming and design is so incredibly immersive you don't notice. If anything, the lack of a heroic plot probably helps, you are just a person trying to get off a hazardous space ship.", 'A little bit too long but god do I love this game.', 'Best horror game ever!!', 'Jogo √© bom, abondonei porque sou c@g√£o']

Title: Super Smash Bros. for Wii U
Summary: Super Smash Bros. for Wii U is the fourth console-based entry in the popular Super Smash Bros. series of fighting games. With an even larger roster of fighters than its predecessors and the introduction eight player battles, Smash for Wii U continues to add to the formula that gamers have loved since 1999.

Title: Super Mario 64 DS
Summary: Super Mario 64, the classic 3D platformer for the Nintendo 64, arrives on the Nintendo DS with all-new features that take advantage of the portable system's dual screens, touch screen, and wireless multiplayer capability. Like the original game, Super Mario 64 DS challenges you to find all the power stars hidden throughout the royal castle in the effort to free Peach imprisoned inside the castle. This time, you can play as Mario, Luigi, Wario, and Yoshi, each of whom has unique abilities. Overcome the challenges on your own or battle up to three of your friends in the multiplayer modes.
Reviews: ["This game pretty much fixes every complaint I have about Super Mario 64. Great game.", "I know everyone loves the original more, but I was raised on this one and I think it beats the original in everyway. Title: Final Fantasy IX
Summary: Final Fantasy IX is the ninth main installment in the FF series. The title is a return to the series's roots, with gameplay features and references to the past games featuring throughout, as well as a medieval fantasy setting and cartoonish art style as a break from the sci-fi slant style of Final Fantasy VII and Final Fantasy VIII.

It was only a simple sentence which now I believe didn‚Äôt do the game true justice. And the truth is, everything that I‚Äôm gonna say has probably been said before, but that‚Äôs ok because that‚Äôs their experience. This is my experience.', "I got stuck on a boss and never finished it in late disk 3... I always wanted to go back and finish. LOVED that the game didn't make me choose a party and jumped around and gave me an opportunity to play each character as they were interesting and well done.", 'El valor de la vida disfrazada como un cuento de ni√±os. As√≠ es c√≥mo resumir√≠a esta maravillosa fantas√≠a que, sin duda, no es solo uno de los mejores de la propia saga, sino uno de los mejores juegos que existen. Las animaciones se siguen viendo absolutamente incre√≠ble a d√≠a de hoy y si bien los escenarios y el mapa mundi se han quedado un poco m√°s obsoletos tampoco se ven nada mal. Adem√°s, con la remasterizaci√≥n los personajes se ven en muy buena calidad.\n                     \n                     No es la primera, ni segunda vez que me he pasado este juego, no s√© cu√°ntas veces lo habr√© rejugado,  pero s√≠ que es la primera vez que me he dedicado a realizar varios extras y completarlos, de modo que hay peque√±os detalles del jeugo que he vivido por primera vez. Lo que s√© seguro es que las posibilidades de que vuelva a rejugar este juego en el futuro son muy altas. M√°s a√∫n si es un forma del rumureado remake, que ojal√° llegue a ser cierto y le haga honor a esta obra maestra.', "can't wait for the part in final fantasy ix-2 where the crew have to bust zidane out of jail for sexual assault", 'A return to the ‚Äúfantasy‚Äù part of the series. Title: Batman: Arkham Asylum
Summary: Using a great variety of gadgets you must make your way around the island, and the asylums halls to find and stop the joker. The game uses a 3-button combat system, but with a great number of gadget abilites which Batman can unlock. This makes for a very cinematic combat experience when fighting the Joker's goons.
Reviews: ['One of the best Batman games of all time', 'Ah, the Arkham games. Truly fantastic games.', "Aged amazingly, the atmosphere is completely unrivaled by any of these licensed comic book games. Even later Arkham games don't really capture the tone and feel of this one.", "I knew this game had a lot of hype behind it but I didn't expect to like it as much as I did. On first glance it looks just decent, the combat seems simpler than Assasin's Creed's and the environments and stealth don't look that special.", 'Good game with great atmosphere, fun gameplay, great music and graphics, but levels feel boring to play in', 'combat can be a little slippy, gameplay can be a little repetitive but']

Title: Mother 3
Summary: A turn-based JRPG and sequel to EarthBound (1994) in which a tragedy surrounding a family in the primitive yet joyful village of Tazmily incites the coming-of-age story of Lucas, the family's younger son, who goes on perilous adventures along with his friends in order to find his missing brother and stop a group of masked men from bringing about the end of the world.

Title: Prey
Summary: In Prey, you awaken aboard Talos I, a space station orbiting the moon in the year 2032. You are the key subject of an experiment meant to alter humanity forever ‚Äì but things have gone terribly wrong. The space station has been overrun by hostile aliens and you are now being hunted. As you dig into the dark secrets of Talos I and your own past, you must survive using the tools found on the station, your wits, weapons, and mind-bending abilities.
Reviews: ['Prey is one of the greatest love letters conceived towards the immersive sim genre, and a masterclass in environmental storytelling.', 'this game is so cool', "While this is technically a replay, it's almost entirely me starting fresh with little memory of the first time I played it to truly enjoy the level of depth the game has. And if there's one thing Prey does right, it's the depth of nearly each and every element it offers you.", 'Borning', '"We got all these cool alien powers you can use. We have teleportation, mimicking objects, pyrokinesis, telekinesis, mind control, and even..."\n                     \n                     "Nah no thanks. I\'ll just make my shotgun a weapon of mass destruction and increase my speed to the point that I\'m playing this like one of those modern boomer shooters."', 'Really good game, but I unfortunately had to stop playing because my disc scratched']

Title: Scarlet Nexus
Summary:
In a far distant future, a psionic hormone was discovered in the human brain, granting people extra-sensory powers and changing the world as we know it.
             

              Just as humanity was entering this new era, deranged mutants known as Others began to descend from the sky with a thirst for human brains. Highly resistant to conventional attack methods, extreme measures needed to be taken to battle the overwhelming threat and preserve humanity.
             

              Those with acute extra-sensory abilities, known as psionics, were our chance to fight the onslaught from above. To this day, psionics have been scouted for their talents and recruited to the Other Suppression Force (OSF), humanity‚Äôs last line of defense.
             

              Take on the role of Yuito Sumeragi, a new recruit to the OSF aiming to become an elite psionic like the one who saved him as a child. Armed with a talent in psycho-kinesis, explore the futuristic city of New Himuka and uncover the mysteries of a Brain Punk future caught between technology and psychic abilities in SCARLET NEXUS.
Reviews: ['A very unique RPG with a fun combat system, and a story that works both of protags together great', "Despite the boxart looking hyper serious the actual game inside is very chuunicore. So be ready for that kind of plot because I like that kind of whacky bullshit but I know it's not everybody's cup of tea. The story is the main focus going on really long and taking up a lot of time. It's on the long side, but it's an alright story to get attached to the cast with. It also has social links, which unlike social links aren't interactive at all so you're mostly just in pure VN mode when those come up (and you will get a lot of those especially late game). Thankfully a few of these social links do use actual gameplay segments to break them up.", 'Potentiel rat√©', "I completed both characters. I describe this game as a Bandai Namco anime fueled drug trip. It's fucking wild. I think I would like it a lot more if it wasn't 70 hours long though. It overstays its welcome a lot. I recommend checking it out at some point. I do like a lot of the combat but it runs dry after a bit.
