Os personagens acabam sendo os padr√µes tamb√©m: A Milf protetora, a amiguinha de inf√¢ncia, a Kuudere que mal fala 3 palavras, o rival do protagonista e etc, coisa que tamb√©m n√£o √© ruim, eles fazem bem seu papel na hist√≥ria, cada um tendo seu devido desenvolvimento. Nesses 2 pontos o jogo n√£o √© ruim, mas nada nele √© original, praticamente tudo √© reaproveitado de outras obras, pessoalmente n√£o foi um problema.']

Title: Dead Space
Summary: The sci-fi survival horror classic Dead Space returns, completely rebuilt from the ground up by Motive Studios to offer a deeper and more immersive experience. Harnessing the power of the Frostbite game engine and next generation consoles, this remake brings jaw-dropping visual fidelity and improvements to gameplay while staying true to the original.
Reviews: ["It's just aight. The visual upgrade, Gunner Wright cursing corporations, and making the whole Ishimura interconnected with backtracking for goodies are nice. It misses the mark on its combat tho with both Isaac's kit being overtuned and enemy aggression being nonexistent in encounters. I can't say that I trust this team with remaking Dead Space 2.", 'Resident Evil 4 –≤ –∫–æ—Å–º–æ—Å–µ, –Ω–æ —É —Ç–µ–±—è –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∏ –≤—Ä–∞–≥–æ–≤.  –ù–æ —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –º—ã –µ—â–µ –∏ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–¥–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è.', 'If there was no horror or combat, and the whole game was just running around the ship repairing things, I would still play it.', 'Upgrade over the original in pretty much every way. Loved the open ship how the weapons and upgrade system was done.', "I never got to play the original Dead Space, and in a way, I'm thankful for that since my first experience with this story was in this gorgeous remake.", "It's been over 10 years since I played the original Dead Space, so my memory of its intricacies is certainly hazy, but the fact that this remake is able to exceed my remembrance of that original experience is telling. Everything done here is lovingly reflective of the original game and the parts that are different are welcome additions. Having Isaac speak is done thoughtfully, without overwhelming the player with dialogue, and the side missions are interesting exposition into the series' awesome lore. This remake does still have a couple issues that the original game did as well, such as unoriginal boss fights and some disorienting zero gravity combat, but nothing there takes away from this otherwise excellent experience."]

Title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim - Special Edition
Summary:
Skyrim special edition is a remaster of the classic from 2011. Now with upgraded visuals.
              
              Skyrim reimagines and revolutionises the open-world fantasy epic, bringing to life a complete virtual world open for you to explore any way you choose.

['I picked up Skyrim special edition in December 2016 at a Kmart. I don't know how this game enthralled me but it did and I both love and despise this game. I guess the age old saying is true. It truely does just work.", 'estaremos jugando', 'main vanilla save - 654hr 2min
                     
                     total w mod games -', "i'm too lazy to mod this game but i want big titty men in my game", 'Bom, por que n√£o come√ßar as reviews falando do meu jogo favorito de todos os tempos?
                     
                     Me lembro bem de quando Skyrim foi lan√ßado pela primeira vez, eu estava perto de fazer 8 anos e tinha uma enorme fascina√ß√£o pelo tema medieval, ent√£o seria um prato pra cheio pra mim (n√£o conhecia nada da franquia The Elder Scrolls). O jogo foi lan√ßado e por volta de 7 meses depois ganhei o jogo para Xbox 360 e foi simplesmente a melhor coisa que eu tinha visto at√© ent√£o.
                     
                     Skyrim me apresentou um universo vasto de uma terra m√≠stica com diferentes caminhos para seguir, sendo uma pessoa boa ou uma pessoa m√°. O que mais me chamou aten√ß√£o no meio disso tudo era a forma que voc√™ iria seguir para que no final, tudo fosse diferente de como voc√™ come√ßou; um prisioneiro talvez capturado por engano enquanto estava pr√≥ximo de uma emboscada imperial.
                     
                     O jogo se desenrola de uma maneira simples e objetiva de mostrar o retorno dos drag√µes ap√≥s muitos anos de seu desaparecimento, trazendo Alduin como principal antagonista e apresentando o seu personagem como "O √öltimo Dragonborn", predestinado a causar o fim da tirania drac√¥nica e limpar as terras de Nirn.
                     
                     Eu n√£o tenho palavras o suficiente para falar de como esse jogo √© incr√≠vel por sua simplicidade, nunca precisou ter gr√°ficos extravagantes ou uma gameplay inovadora (principalmente se tratando de algo da Bethesda). Skyrim simplesmente foi espetacular em fazer o jogador se sentir em casa, tendo suas pr√≥prias escolhas e apreciando sua evolu√ß√£o sem tentar empurrar as coisas pela barriga como em muitos, muitos e muitos jogos atuais fazem.
                     
                     De tempos em tempos volto pra jogar novamente, acho t√£o estranho como um jogo simples com uma hist√≥ria n√£o t√£o bem desenvolvida consegue me prender tanto sem me fazer enjoar de tudo, at√© mesmo de quests que eu tenho 100% de certeza de j√° ter feito e que eu ainda me lembro a proced√™ncia inteira. Amo o conceito de ir do ponto A ao ponto B para depois retornar ao ponto A, digo isso pois sempre fa√ßo um milh√£o de coisas durante os trajetos e por muitas vezes nem finalizo o mesmo, de tanta liberdade e escolha que √© oferecida.
                     
                     The Elder Scrolls V n√£o √© um jogo perfeito, est√° longe de ser. H√° muitos erros e pontas soltas na hist√≥ria, a gameplay e gr√°ficos s√£o severamente ultrapassados, isso sem mencionar os diversos bugs que por muitas das vezes podem atrapalhar a experi√™ncia de um novo jogador. A comunidade de modders demonstram um carinho t√£o imenso por esse jogo que "arrumaram" o jogo a troco de nada, tiraram parte de seu tempo livre para se dedicar em tornar algo que seja bom, tendo b√¥nus de hist√≥ria n√£o oficial, armas, mapas, TUDO.
                     
                     Eu amo esse jogo do fundo do meu cora√ß√£o, considero o meu jogo favorito por muitos anos, me ajudou a ignorar muita coisa pesada que estava acontecendo na minha vida, e mesmo que n√£o seja perfeito, √© perfeito pra mim. 10/10.']

Title: Fallout 3
Summary:
Fallout 3 from the creators of the award-winning Oblivion, featuring one of the most realized game worlds ever created. Create any kind of character you want and explore the open wastes of post-apocalyptic Washington D.C. Every minute is a fight for survival as you encounter Super Mutants, Ghouls, Raiders and other dangers of the Wasteland. Prepare for the future.
             

              The third game in the Fallout series, Fallout 3 is a singleplayer action role-playing game (RPG) set in a post-apocalyptic Washington DC. Combining the horrific insanity of the Cold War era theory of mutually assured destruction gone terribly wrong, with the kitschy naivety of American 1950s nuclear propaganda, Fallout 3 will satisfy both players familiar with the popular first two games in its series as well as those coming to the franchise for the first time.
Reviews: ["C'monnnn how does this have a 3.4 average :(", "Fallout games are good, but the story and its progression were weird to me and it is not as immersive as I was hoping. Also I don't know if I'm just dumb because the DC area navigation made no sense.", 'This game is so boring and so ugly its not even funny. I was planning on playing f3, fnv and f4 in order, but i just cant, i really cant.', 'underrated by New Vegas fanboys, overrated by Skyrim-loving redditors. has an inescapably powerful atmosphere, perhaps the strongest that Bethesda has ever crafted. greatly falls short in quests, storytelling, characters, and other areas, but the raw feeling of the world always has me coming back.', "I played this after Fallout 4 so my experience with it is different from a lot of other people. Gunplay is really not that good overall, especially automatic weapons. It's pretty archaic now so enemies feel like they have more health than normal with the bloom on the guns. The Wasteland is also ugly. Why is everything green and brown? There are other colors and I feel like the game could look a lot better. I'm not a big graphics guy but New Vegas is the same engine and looks so much better. Anyways, I like 3-Dog he is awesome and makes this game so fucking good. I still like exploring the different areas of DC and NoVA. Fallout for me is good when I can explore every single area I can see and go deep into buildings and dungeons. The subway map could be clearer too since it's easy to get lost and then needing to waste a bunch of ammo on Ghouls. Even with my complaining, I still was engrossed with the game as a whole and I'm glad I sunk a whole lot of time into exploring and leveling up.", 'Fallout 4 better']

Title: Life is Strange
Summary: Life is Strange is a five part episodic game that sets out to revolutionize story based choice and consequence games by allowing the player to rewind time and affect the past, present and future.
Reviews: ['I liked it', 'Simply a life changing experience', 'a criatividade desse jogo √© espetacular', "it's absolutely amazing that a game studio could make a definitively mediorcre experience, got absolutely nothing out of playing this, and felt absolutely nothing as well. this game is mid as fuck.", 'dont play this if ur over the age of 18 it will be a little "cringe"', "Very enjoyable, I really enjoyed the vibe of this game - music, characters etc. Really made me reminisce the mid 2010's Tumblr era. The visuals are wonderful. Honestly, it is a shame that I did not give this game a try earlier."]

Title: Octopath Traveler II
Summary:
This game is a brand-new entry in the Octopath Traveler series. It takes the series‚Äô HD-2D graphics, a fusion of retro pixel art and 3DCG, to even greater heights.
              
              In the world of Solistia, eight new travelers venture forth into an exciting new era.
              
              Where will you go? What will you do? Whose tale will you bring to life?
              
              Every path is yours to take. Embark on an adventure all your own.
Reviews: ["Asano's vision was to create a SNES JRPG with modern day quality of life upgrades.. I couldn't really say that he achieved his dream with the first game, but the second game was a clear step up in almost every single way possible.", 'few games have even half as much heart and care put into their characters and their stories, and the addition of actual banter and things like duo chapters do nothing but help to extenuate the already beautiful writing these characters are full of', 'Good game with calming bgm\n                     \n                     Will surely play it again when I have the time', 'A triumphant success for Team Asano. Octopath 2 is an improvement over the first in almost all aspects. While the first game felt rigid with its repetitive chapter structure and circular world, this one feels open with a world that lets you go basically wherever you want. The writing is also tighter. While both games feature fairly by the number fantasy plots, this game features far more interesting scenarios that take advantage of the setting and characters.', 'Todos os aspectos necess√°rios pra se fazer um √≥timo JRPG est√£o presentes aqui com absoluta mestria. OST que eleva a experi√™ncia, personagens super carism√°ticos e bem trabalhados e um combate original e divertido. Um dos melhores JRPGs que j√° joguei.', "While the first Octopath Traveler wasn't perfect, I thought it was a wonderful little game. The introduction of the HD-2D style, 8 little contained stories with a couple of memorable characters, a good soundtrack, and a fairly satisfying turn-based combat system. Octopath Traveler 2 improves vastly upon its predecessor in every conceivable way."]

Title: Call of Duty: Black Ops
Summary: Call of Duty: Black Ops is the seventh main Call of Duty game and the sequel to Call of Duty: World at War. The game differs from most previous installments, which would involve a usual three-country campaign, while Call of Duty: Black Ops features two playable countries (Russia and the USA) but only has an American campaign. Several new features are also introduced, such as dive-to-prone and the available use of a flashlight on certain weapons. Furthermore, the campaign's playable characters now speak while being controlled by the player.
Reviews: ['Mi cod fav', 'My first CoD game I played a lot. I enjoyed the campaign and it being my first CoD multiplayer I played online, I was bad but had a lot of fun playing with friends.', 'Kino der toten', 'The best Call of Duty game. The story is easily the best. I haven‚Äôt played BO2 so.', '√áOK ƒ∞Yƒ∞ƒ∞ƒ∞', 'Kinda watched my brother play it so I tried it out too']

Title: Octopath Traveler
Summary: A role-playing game from the Bravely Default team is being developed exclusively for the Nintendo Switch. They have brought a new world to life through a mix of CG, pixel art, and "HD-2D" visuals.
Reviews: ['Learn to embrace the grind.', 'None of the characters stories clicked with me dropped it around half way olberic was cool though', 'You can steal candy from children and throw wild boars at them for good meassure', "Nul a chier + pire systeme de combat, c'est de la merde les faiblesses", 'Waste of money.', 'One of the best RPGs on Switch']

Title: Metal Gear Solid
Summary: Metal Gear Solid is a stealth game created by Hideo Kojima which follows the MSX2 video games Metal Gear and Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake. Despite a transition to 3D, Metal Gear Solid's gameplay remains similar to his predecessors. The game utilizes a traditional top-down view and the player must navigate the protagonist Solid Snake through the game's areas without being detected. Detection will set off an alarm which draws armed enemies to his location. Conversations with Snake's allies and cutscenes are used extensively to advance the plot and gain more insight into it. Metal Gear Solid is regarded as one of the greatest and most important video games of all time, and helped popularize the stealth genre and in-engine cinematic cutscenes.
Reviews: ['WHAT IS THIS SETUP YOOOOO THAT WAS SO GOOD AT THE END', "It's a great game, but the end of it is tedious, lots of cool mechanics to play with through the whole game and has mostly aged well, the PSX release is my favorite visually", 'Pfftt idk where to start beside saying that I\'m genuinely woah by this whole game to describe it the best to me. It\'s like Kojima took a bite of the apple of ambition and managed to consume it completely. From the time this game was made in it\'s genuinely the perfect stealth game. The mechanics are so simple but effective it just works really well. Love how the gameplay and storytelling are so well intertwined into the game it\'s like a perfect in sync dance throughout the whole game it\'s so impressive how well taught out the game is. The directing how cinematic it feels but not to the point where it\'s immersion breaking. Funny how a game from the 90s does the whole "video game movie" approach so much more fluid than modern games does which makes it even more impressive. but yea want to say more but after playing a classic not much more can be said. I love Snake , I love the story & message and I love this game Thank You Kojima.', 'Good asf', 's√≥ os controles q s√£o ruim, mas fora isso nn tem oq reclamar nn', 'Changed the way stories are told in games. A true original, which is one of the rarest things you can be.']

Title: Pentiment
Summary: A 16th-century narrative adventure set in Upper Bavaria, following Andreas Maler, a journeyman artist working in the bygone scriptorium of Kiersau Abbey during a time of great social unrest. While finishing his masterpiece, Andreas inadvertently becomes entangled in a series of murders that take place over 25 years. Peasants, thieves, craftsmen, monks, nuns, nobles, and even saints must be investigated and interrogated to expose the truth.
Reviews: ['Xbox might suck at AAA games but their smaller stuff is actually quite decent these days', 'Lovely details, very well hidden decision trees and it really makes you question how you are using your ingame time and if you could have done better. And while it enforces consequences it still feels fair.', "This game makes you deal with the consequences of your actions in the best--but also in the most difficult--ways and it's one of my favorite things about it.\n                     \n                     Being put in almost impossible situations and then looking back and wondering whether anything you said was the reason for how past events transpired or not made for an incredibly captivating experience.", '√âste juego me hizo dar vueltas a muchas cosas de mi vida, sin importar los posibles problemas que pueda tener en cuanto argumento y uno que otro error por ah√≠, Pentiment cruzo la l√≠nea donde ning√∫n error me es importante, para m√≠, es perfecto tal y como es.', 'More like a book than a game, great story, but not great game.', "josh sawyer's love for history was so deep and convincing it was actually making me tear up"]

Title: The Outer Worlds
Summary: The Outer Worlds is a new single-player sci-fi RPG from Obsidian Entertainment and Private Division. As you explore the furthest reaches of space and encounter a host of factions all vying for power, who you decide to become will determine the fate of everyone in Halcyon. In the corporate equation for the colony, you are the unplanned variable.
Reviews:
["I got VERY close to the end, couldn't finish the final area, and didn't feel like grinding. Really enjoyed some of the characters. Really Pavarti. Played this game mostly for Pavarti and her adorable crush and that story. When that was over I had much less investment in the main story.", 'decently enjoyable game with okay combat and good characters and a story that really could have used another 5 hours of content at the end when you get to the hope and requires a fucking "heres where every character ended up after we ended at an inopportune place". like just add another bit of game with that in it', "Probably wont go back to this. Played it with game pass' cloud streaming so I had to use a controller rather than m&kb which made combat unbearable.", 'Some of the writing is pretty solid, the dialogue is often funny & I found a lot of characters and their arcs very interesting. It wasn't enough to get me to keep playing tough. The combat felt flat and a lot of the choices you make story wise feel shallow. The subtext of the game gives me a "both sides bad" vibe. Also the inventory menu and UI is kinda ugly lol', "This was a perfectly adequate game. It didn't do anything groundbreaking or change the formula but it wasn't horrible either and tbh that's what we need. In a time where every video game needs to either be a massive blockbuster title or a small humble indie (that still breaks records),
                     
                      The Outer Worlds
                     
                     fills in that gap‚Äîthe not quite megasuccess triple a but they actually have a budget.", 'The sun is our best friend']

Title: Shadow of the Colossus
Summary:
Tales speak of an ancient land where creatures the size of mountains, roam the majestic landscape. Bound to the land, these creatures hold a key to a mystical power of revival - a power you must obtain to waken a loved one.
             

              Shadow of the Colossus is a majestic journey through ancient lands to seek out and destroy gigantic mythical beasts. With your trusty horse at your side, explore the spacious lands and unearth each Colossi. Armed with your wits, a sword and a bow, use cunning and strategy to topple each behemoth.
             

              A remake of the critically-claimed game of the same title. Also from the minds that brought you The Last Guardian & ICO
Reviews:
['Will finish it later', 'Eu poderia simplesmente registrar aqui que esse √© o melhor jogo de todos os tempos e s√≥ pular para outra review, contudo, n√£o sou esse tipo de pessoa. Para eu n√£o existe um jogo perfeito, ent√£o voc√™s n√£o ver√£o um jogo 5 estrelas nas minhas reviews.
                     
                     Ainda lembro do meu eu mais jovem ficando interessado pelos mist√©rios das Terras Proibidas, 17¬∫ Colosso, Black Bird, The Dam, Monkey, Adar Flam e final alternativo (esse √∫ltimo eu nunca botei f√©). √â, tempos mais simples... mas vamos ao que interessa: Vers√£o de PS4.
                     
                     Bom, √© um remake que honra o universo constru√≠do em Shadow of the Colossus. Os gr√°ficos novos, sons polidos, vegeta√ß√£o, os pr√≥prios colossos, os personagens humanos e o vazio. Sim, o vazio de voc√™ ser o √∫nico humano cavalgando com sua √©gua em uma terra desolada at√© o pr√≥ximo ser, ou at√© mesmo passeando, faz com que o player n√£o se importe com isso mais come√ßa a considerar algo natural.
                     
                     Eu ouvi em algum lugar que o Nomad (criador de conte√∫do sobre Shadow at√© hoje) estivesse envolvido nas "Rel√≠quias Douradas", mas n√£o posso dar uma certeza sobre isso. Por√©m, o que essas rel√≠quias geraram de mist√©rio na √©poca do jogo foi comovente. Ver a comunidade se juntando para mandar a localiza√ß√£o delas, procurando-as, fazendo lives, e, finalmente, ap√≥s encontrarem todas as 79 (muito espec√≠fico) tamb√©m descobriram o local na qual elas serviriam. Uma sala abaixo do Templo/Santu√°rio da Adora√ß√£o que continha uma espada secreta.
                     
                     Agora voc√™ deve estar se perguntando: "Nossa, todo esse trabalho para uma espada?" Sim. Pense bem, quantos jogos que voc√™ j√° viu a comunidade se reunir para encontrar algo secreto ou passarem dicas por conta de um item? Hoje em dia para conseguirmos algo melhor √© s√≥ gastarmos money na loja virtual, mas essa sensa√ß√£o de ap√≥s um trabalho duro e ser recompensado no final de tudo n√£o tem pre√ßo.
                     
                     Vamos para outro t√≥pico chamado de "IA". A intelig√™ncia artificial dos colossos, em alguns, continua duvidosa, fazendo com que a batalha se estenda mais do que o necess√°rio. Posso citar o Phaedra (4¬∫ colosso), Pelagia (12¬∫ colosso) e Argus (15¬∫ colosso). Lembrando, estes nomes n√£o s√£o oficiais, a pr√≥pria comunidade quem nomeou os seres.
                     
                     No geral, √© um jogo espetacular que consegue te prender por muito tempo com o fator replay. Al√©m do problema anterior citado existem outros que s√£o mais de nerdola que n√£o entrarei em detalhes, por√©m, um "problema" que li muita gente reclamando √© o fato de n√£o terem adicionado os "colossos exclu√≠dos". E sim, eu compartilho da mesma reclama√ß√£o, mas, na minha vis√£o, n√£o precisariam inser√≠-los diretamente na hist√≥ria. Irei dar um exemplo: Na tal sala secreta abaixo do templo imaginem se colocassem t√°bulas de pedras nas paredes que mostrassem tais colossos e que, ao adorarmos, poder√≠amos entrar naquele cen√°rio e lutar contra o colosso. Isso daria uma motiva√ß√£o a mais para as pessoas quererem ir atr√°s das rel√≠quias e desbloquearem a sala.
                     
                     Mas se fizerem isso em algum Playstation futuro eu quero direito autoral da ideia kkkk', 'So amazing I beat it twice in a day', 'Beautiful game i gotta play it on ps2 for a completely different feel', 'Even though this looks great and it is still SoTC , I feel like the original is so much more interesting visually.
                     
                     Play the original if you can.', "Bluepoint always seems to sacrifice the artstyle for ''realistic graphics.'' At first, games like Shadow of the Colossus and Demon's Souls look pretty, but once you really engage with the original games, you realize how soulless these versions are."]

Title: A Hat in Time
Summary: A Hat in Time is a cute-as-heck 3D platformer featuring a little girl who stitches hats for wicked powers! Freely explore giant worlds and recover Time Pieces to travel to new heights!
Reviews: ['Better than mario sunshine, casting is a bit awkward but game-play and the levels are really creative and tons of fun to traverse', 'My first impression of this game was: "Super Mario Sunshine for the PC". I do think the controls and the camera were better than Super Mario Sunshine.', 'Its a good platformer and the first I 100% and really enjoyed. The main character is smug and the humour is funny.\n                     \n                     Also trans pride.', "It's everything you remember loving about GameCube era platformers and then some. Hat Kid is incredibly fun to control with tight, fluid movements and the world in which the game takes place is insanely charming and funny. Not to mention the fantastic DLC. If I had one complaint it would be I wish the base game had more Time Pieces to collect, as it feels like it's over when you still want more to do. But, on the other hand, I suppose I'm glad it doesn't Donkey Kong 64 things by overstaying it's welcome.", 'Imagine raising three times less the money Yooka-Laylee had and STILL being better than that game LOL.', 'Not a fan of this genre but this game was really fun, good time waster not gonna lie. Recommend it if you like platformers.']

Title: Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII - Reunion
Summary: Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII - Reunion is an HD remaster of the smash hit prequel to Final Fantasy VII. In addition to all graphics being remastered in HD, fully voiced dialogue and new soundtrack arrangements make for a dynamic new retelling of a beloved classic.
Reviews:
['a couple of cring dialogue moments but overall a really good game with a heavy and emotional ending that we knew was coming but still got us. Sephiroth is a top 5 ff character i dont care what anyone says', 'This game is legitimately cute in the way it acts as a prequel to FF7, with it being like, "This characters adventure is only just beginning, but that's for another time". I don't know that's fun to experience.
                     
                     I love the idea of experiencing this world from a new characters perspective, and I kind of wish Square made a spinoff about what this world is like for base level people, in a visual novel or something. Like a game for Reeve and the emotional turmoil he goes through as a man on the inside of Shinra.
                     
                     Anyway though Zack is a really good character, and probably one of my favorite FF characters overall. I love his optimism and how stupid he is sometimes. He truly is the FF7 himbo and the world is better because of it.
                     
                     People have complained about the English voice cast and honestly all of them are an improvement in my eyes, except for Zack who left something to be desired. Which is weird because in the original it seemed to be the exact opposite.
                     
                     I think he has a lot of potential to have a really good performance, he just needs to have better direction in future projects.', "I always wanted to play this game on psp back then, even tho I never played tho original FF7. Sadly never got the chance, because I simply couldn't find the game. Years later the game has been remade and I've finished FF7 Remake, which made this game a must for me to play. A game expanding the FF7 story giving you something till rebirth comes out.", "Toutes les √©toiles vont dans le fait que √ßa approfondit l'histoire de ff7, pas trop aim√© le gameplay", 'Nice little spin-off! I like the extra lore to the FF7 world and the character interactions were really cute. Gameplay was a bit repetitive, especially for 100%, but was always fun in between! The ending just broke my heart.', 'English version:
                     
                     Press F to pay respect... Zack SOLDIER 1¬∞CLASS']

Title: Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars
Summary: A JRPG entry in the Super Mario franchise in which Mario meets many unlikely allies in order to jump and fight his way through the Mushroom Kingdom and collect stars to repair the Star Road, the pathway that grants people's wishes, which was destroyed by Smithy, the otherworldly entity that hijacked Bowser's castle and threw the Kingdom into disarray.
Reviews: ['People who brush off Super Mario RPG as "some obscure Mario spin-off" just because they\'re angry people wanted Geno in Smash Bros are not giving the game enough credit.', 'This game was my introduction to JRPGs. It is still the best Mario RPG made. It is crazy fun with a good storyline.', 'I loved this game before playing the final fantasy series and i love it a lot more after. Top 5 games ever made', "it's like paper mario but it looks like donkey kong country", "An approachable jrpg with Super Mario theming from an era where that wasn't a thing, featuring memorable characters, a rhythmic battle system, isometric art style and an actual story. It's high time this one got a remaster or remake. Good thing is, thanks to it the Paper Mario games became a thing.", 'This was okay. Always thought about playing it since watching flash animations an listening to that one song as a kid. Fun to finally get some context.']

Title: Overwatch 2
Summary: Reunite and stand together in a new age of heroes. Overwatch 2 builds on an award-winning foundation of epic competitive play, and challenges the world‚Äôs heroes to team up, power up, and take on an overwhelming outbreak of threats around the globe.
Reviews: ['Hey everyone...\n                     \n                     Maybe the 3rd game will not actually ruin everything', "It's just overwatch, but they've made so many bad decisions it's off the fun list of games", "Played one match with a life weaver and haven't touched it since", 'talvez um dia eu volto', 'Most of the magic is lost in the OW2 update. The battlepass seems uninspired, and only the want of a new hero would make it worth buying.', 'mental illness innit']

Title: Untitled Goose Game
Summary:
It's a lovely morning in the village and you are a horrible goose.
             

              Untitled Goose Game is a slapstick-stealth-sandbox, where you are a goose let loose on an unsuspecting village. Make your way around town, from peoples' back gardens to the high street shops to the village green, setting up pranks, stealing hats, honking a lot, and generally ruining everyone‚Äôs day.
Reviews: ['Tornar a vida das pessoas um inferno enquanto controla um ganso. Tem como ser mais terap√™utico do que isso? N√£o tem.', "It's so satisfying to play a once-popular meme game long after the Youtube/Twitch spotlight has faded and finding out that it's a really charming little experience that still holds up on its own.", 'silly little game', 'Elite', "Mischief and absurdity define Untitled Goose Game's appeal. I have gotten multiple non-gamers to pick up a controller with me and have a blast causing all sorts of inconvenience and trouble for the residents of this imaginary town. During which, we both smile coming to grips with the ability to just honk at each other and do goose things we never imagined we would partake in. This is a truly amazing product that I cherish the opportunities for good memories it has supplied me and look to getting more as I make new friends.", "Untitled Goose Game is a charming fun little with little flaws but does little to blow you away either. It's a game unlike any other game I have played, being a stealth puzzle game. All the puzzles are a lot of fun to figure out, a few even have multiple solutions to them and require some thought. My main issue with the game comes from the multiplayer, which is mode I played most recently as of writing this review. The game very clearly isn't designed for two players in mind, and a few puzzles feel trivialized when you have two geese which one can easily distract nearby npcs and the other can easily complete the task. Also, the second player geese isn't that different appearance wise to the first players, which had me and the person I was playing constantly mixing up our two geese. It was still a super fun and charming game on multiplayer, but I would recommend first playing on single player since that's where the game really shines."]

Title: Metroid Prime Remastered
Summary:
Get behind the visor of intergalactic bounty hunter Samus Aran in her critically-acclaimed first-person adventure.
             

              Step into the boots of Samus Aran as you navigate the winding paths and interconnected environments of an alluring-yet-dangerous alien planet. Use powers like the iconic Morph Ball and Grapple Beam to revisit hard-to-reach areas and find a path forward. With revamped graphics, sound, unlockable art, and updated control schemes, Samus‚Äô 3D platforming debut has reached greater heights. Calm and capable, Samus takes on this solo mission...but she is far from alone.
Reviews:
["Even though I consider this to be the only Prime game that is truly a mastapeece, I really hope Prime 2 and 3 get the same treatment this game was given as well, this is easily the best-looking game on the Switch and it's as much of a blast to play now as it was back in 2002. No Fusion Suit is stinky though, come on Retro.", 'Still good', 'Spent 80% of my time thinking
                     
                      "This IS a masterpiece"
                     
                     and 20% of my time saying
                     
                      "Oh fuck off, this is shite"
                     
                     but very angrily. And for a beloved classic, that ain't bad.', 'First time really playing this game (other than messing with it as a stupid kid and never progressing) and I can say I understand all the love. The game is very fun and holds up well minus a few little nitpicks, such as the map and some of the navigation, but nothing major enough to detract from the enjoyment. I still think I prefer 2D Metroid but that doesn‚Äôt mean I didn‚Äôt really enjoy my time with it.', "It's everything I wanted it to be and more.", 'Mentir√≠a si dijera que Metroid Prime no me ha parecido un muy buen juego y que me lo he zampado, PERO tambi√©n es cierto que hay varias cosas que me han chirriado bastante a lo largo del juego, la mayor√≠a en la recta final.']

Title: Bloodborne
Summary: An action RPG in which the player embodies a Hunter who, after being transfused with the mysterious blood local to the city of Yharnam, sets off into a "night of the Hunt", an extended night in which Hunters may phase in and out of dream and reality in order to thin the outbreak of abominable beasts that plague the land and, for the more resilient and insightful Hunters, uncover the answers to the Hunt's many mysteries.
Reviews: ['Bloodborne is my number one game from the "soulslike" genre, and I believe it\'s the pinnacle of the games From Software\'s made this far. The combination of a unique, well-executed aesthetic, with great bosses, deep lore, and fun fast-paced combat, makes for a 10/10 game even without the Old Hunters DLC (which is the best souls content of all). I\'ve played through Bloodborne several times over the years, but now just recently went back through the chalice dungeons for the first time in years and decided to write a review.', 'The early game was perfect, but the second half had a bit of a balancing problem. Sure, Fromsoft never did an actual "fair" game, but some of the bosses or areas feel a bit tedious. When you die sometimes you blame the game instead of yourself.', '"You can\'t beat me Gehrman! I am the Bloodborne!"-Johnathon Bloodbornius the 6th', 'Quitando lo obvio como la complicaci√≥n de entender la historia\n                     \n                     El gameplay a mi me encanto y hacer parry con un trabuco me encanto', 'What a good game, I remember that the first time I played Bloodborne I thought it was very good, I already liked the atmosphere, the gameplay, the story (even if it was shown in crumbs) and mainly the aesthetics, the cosmic horror and also not least important, the soundtrack.', 'TOMA NO C@ ME DA CURA INFINITAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA']

Title: Mass Effect 2
Summary:
Are you prepared to lose everything to save the galaxy? You'll need to be, Commander Shephard. It's time to bring together your greatest allies and recruit the galaxy's fighting elite to continue the resistance against the invading Reapers. So steel yourself, because this is an astronomical mission where sacrifices must be made. You'll face tougher choices and new, deadlier enemies. Arm yourself and prepare for an unforgettable intergalactic adventure.
             

              Game Features:
             

              Shift the fight in your favour. Equip yourself with powerful new weapons almost instantly thanks to a new inventory system. Plus, an improved health regeneration system means you'll spend less time hunting for restorative items.
             

              Make every decision matter. Divisive crew members are just the tip of the iceberg, Commander, because you'll also be tasked with issues of intergalactic diplomacy. And time's a wastin' so don't be afraid to use new prompt-based actions that let you interrupt conversations, even if they could alter the fate of your crew...and the galaxy.
             

              Forge new alliances, carefully. You'll fight alongside some of your most trustworthy crew members, but you'll also get the opportunity to recruit new talent. Just choose your new partners with care because the fate of the galaxy rests on your shoulders, Commander.
Reviews: ['*Played via the Legendary Collection on PS4', 'Pues miranda taba buena\n                     \n                     Y Garrus me cae bien', 'The experience is the trilogy, but still a solid game on its own', 'I played Mass Effect 2 in mid-2020, not so coincidentally during the pandemic. This game came after me completing Mass Effect one, therefore, I was already a big fan. The whole story was great, conversations felt real and I loved each and every character. I played without DLC, so never got the chance to go back to Liara √∞≈∏Àú‚Äù, however the game was awesome. Also asari rule34 gotta be my favourite art sub genre.', 'Made me care about the world much more than other games.. again I love it. Will flesh out review in future.', 'I played this game dozen of times truly a must-have']

Title: Hades
Summary: A rogue-lite hack and slash dungeon crawler in which Zagreus, son of Hades the Greek god of the dead, attempts to escape his home and his oppressive father by fighting the souls of the dead through the various layers of the ever-shifting underworld, while getting to know and forging relationships with its inhabitants.
Reviews: ['Zag kinda bad tho.', 'Played it a shit ton when it first came out, and sank another 120 hours into it when I got a new pc. Perfect roguelike.', 'A great rougelike with fantastic dialogue and story, hyped for hades 2', 'De las mejores de su tipo\n                     \n                     Mas que nada por como usa muy bien su genero', 'masterpiece', 'Story and characters kept me motivated when gameplay didn‚Äôt (and it did most of the time).']

Title: God Hand
Summary:
THERE AIN'T NO JUSTICE IN THE
              
              WILD, WEIRD WEST. JUST YOU.
              
              Things can't get any worse after demonic thugs cut your arm off, right? Dead wrong, partner. The lady you saved from them has only gone and given you the legendary GOD HAND as a replacement - the ultimate hand-to-hand weapon. Every undead outlaw in a Stetson, rootin' tootin' demon and circus freak in the prairies is going to want to fight you for it. Welcome to the town of Asskickin... have a nice stay y'all.
             

              BIG HAND - Explosive martial arts and hand-to-hand action get in your face and ugly. No bullets, lots of bruised knuckles.
             

              SLAP STICKS - Totally customisable fight system. Pull off the most outrageous combo moves ever with awesome God Hand powers - punch your opponent into orbit!
             

              FIGHTING FORM - Pugilistic adventure from the makers of RESIDENT EVIL, DEVIL MAY CRY and VIEWTIFUL JOE!
Reviews: ['No clever humor this time regrettably just saying this is an all timer', "Nobody plays God Hand randomly in the year 2023. Picking it up in a 5 dollar bin and discovering one of the best action games of the generation was for when we were younger men. So if you're playing it now, it's hard to not squint and look around every corner for the greatness gamer know-it-alls talk about.", 'n√£o fui p√°reo pra este jogo', 'PQ ESSE JOGO INCR√çVEL N√ÉO TEM REMASTER PQ?????? NEM PRECISA DE REMAKE, S√ì DEIXAR MAIS BONITO T√Å √ìTIMO!!!', "Brutally difficult game. I wanted to finish the game badly but didn't have the patience to be good at it so I finished it with cheats. :( Fun game though", "Finally got around to playing this after hearing so much about it, and it was as good as everyone was saying! Combat had plenty of depth that I'm not knowledgeable enough to talk about in length, but even with what I knew it was incredibly satisfying. The dynamic difficulty felt really good, and did its job giving me a constant challenge throughout the game. Story was the perfect amount of stupid, and although I didn't find much of the music memorable (apart from the credits) it still sounded good. My only major issue is some levels being a bit annoying to get through, and some general issues to do with the age of the game (I understand that it's important to the combat, but the tank controls can still feel awkward at times.)\n                     \n                     Overall really glad I played this though! Decent chance I'd raise the score to a 10 eventually."]

Title: Borderlands 2
Summary: A new era of shoot and loot is about to begin. Play as one of four new vault hunters facing off against a massive new world of creatures, psychos and the evil mastermind, Handsome Jack. Make new friends, arm them with a bazillion weapons and fight alongside them in 4 player co-op on a relentless quest for revenge and redemption across the undiscovered and unpredictable living planet.
Reviews: ["For me, the characters carry this game. Each time the game introduces a character, they have a unique personality. No matter how little they appear in the game, every character leaves an impression on the player. Also, the dialogue is funny enough that I didn't want to miss any of it. Despite all those things, at times the game feels too easy. An enemy would appear with a cutscene, then be dead five seconds later. Overall, the story, characters, and design are all top-tier. However, the enemies' abilities mostly underperformed how cool they looked.", 'badassŸÜÿ¥ŸàŸá ÿßŸÑ', 'Hilarious (at least for its time), fun, and has great replayability. Personal favorite looter-shooter.', 'fuck you jba7', 'there\'s a lot of cool stuff and i do like a lot of the visual design (gaige is cute although the "anarchy" stuff in media always makes me roll my eyes) but i didn\'t really enjoy my playthrough. enemies felt a bit spongy for me and while some of the jokes are funny a lot of it just falls flat. i don\'t inherently mind dated humor (i love fallout 2 and that game is just EPIC 90s pop culture jokes) but in BL2 it just makes me kind of go "oh yeah, i remember that" and just kind of roll my eyes.', "Easily the best game in the series, so much replay value, great story that's perfect length, incredibly in-depth and lengthy post game."]

Title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
Summary: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is the sequel to The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. The setting for Link‚Äôs adventure has been expanded to include the skies above the vast lands of Hyrule.
Reviews:
["It's been 6 years and they still couldn't figure out how to fix the fact that Link and can pause in the middle of a fight, consume 6,000 apples, and continue like nothing happened.", 'Tho I cant justify a 4.5 stars, in my mind I rate this higher than BOTW: its everything BOTW is, and then some more.', 'The Legend of Zelda Tears of the kingdom sem d√∫vidas √© um dos jogos mais divertidos que joguei nos √∫ltimos tempos, melhora diversos aspectos do seu antecessor e adiciona novos recursos super interessantes, mas por outro lado ainda comete deslizes em alguns aspectos que poderiam ser diferentes do que foi apresentado, vou relatar um pouco da minha experi√™ncia com jogo, que no geral foi muito mais positiva do que negativa, por√©m nem tudo √© perfeito.', 'No score yet but this is the first modern Nintendo game to actually make me feel an emotion other than overwheming dread or "Yeah it's pretty good I guess". This makes me feel
                     
                      euphoric.', "it's good, but not 70 dollars good. but they're gonna get away with it because it's good", 'Masterpiece.
                     
                     I loved BOTW, but this hit me on an entirely different level.
                     
                     It is very similar to BOTW, as in 80% of the systems and logic of that game is transferred here.
                     
                     But overall, the narrative is much richer, the shrines are definitely more fun (cept for labyrinth ones, I hate those everywhere), and the new gameplay mechanics are super fun.
                     
                     It is really like gmod+besiege and I love both of those, so the whole mix was an explosion of fun for me.
                     
                     The final boss was so much better than BOTW imo, and the way the story closed left me very satisfied.
                     
                     Another thing I want to mention is the polish of the game. I don‚Äôt remember a single game in the last 10 years that was this polished. EVERYTHING WORKS. I know it might sound stupid, but in the modern gaming landscape it is a thing to be praised. I encountered pretty much 0 bugs from start to finish, except for some performance issues, but we all know the drill, old mobile chip from 2016.
                     
                     Anyway, what a great journey, can‚Äôt wait for the inevitable DLC to add master mode to this lol.']

Title: Super Mario Bros.
Summary: A side scrolling 2D platformer and first entry in the Super Mario franchise, Super Mario Bros. follows Italian plumber Mario as he treks across many levels of platforming challenges featuring hostile enemies to rescue Princess Peach from the evil king Bowser.
Reviews:
['How we got to where we are today :)', 'Thank you, Nintendo!', 'aged like diamond', 'what a CLASSIC', "I'm not really a Mario fan at all, I don't like his design much, nor do I enjoy platformers that much either. However, I do love the charm of the Mario world, the creatures in it, the world designs etc. Peach, Daisy, Birdo, Yoshis, Toads, Goombas, Boos, almost all the Mario series enemies are really well designed, weird and quirky. Which is a very fun and exciting thing to explore and interact with.", "It is still worth playing.
                     
                     Bros 3 has tighter controls and better overall feel. World triumphs with it's exploration, but it is really cool to go back in time and see how this amazing franchise came to be.
                     
                     It still plays great, has good levels and is just fun."]

Title: The Last of Us Remastered
Summary: The Last of Us Remastered is an updated release of the PS3 game The Last of Us. It is identical to the PS3 version but runs at a 1080p resolution and incorporates character models with a higher resolution. There are also improved shadows and lighting, upgraded textures, 60 frames per second and other types of improvements. In addition to the base game, two map packs and the expansion The Last of Us: Left Behind are included.
Reviews: ['Oblig√©', 'I really enjoyed this game. I played it alongside watching the show, so was sometimes ahead and sometimes behind in the story. Either way the story is great and well acted - I was quite emotional at points.', 'I reached a point where Joel pointed out how close they were to finally reaching the hospital, and suddenly realised I was in no way ready to part with these characters. A sign of a great work.', 'This game is poetry.', 'Walmart walking dead season 1', 'Found it a bit boring.']

Title: Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening
Summary: Devil May Cry 3: Dante's Awakening is a prequel to the first Devil May Cry. The game plays very differently from its predecessors, as it puts much more emphasis on style rather than simple demon slaying. As such, combat is much more intense and faster than before. An all-new Style system that allows you to select your fighting style has also been incorporated.
Reviews: ['This is probably top 5 hardest games I\'ve ever beaten in my entire life. Huge trial and error that doesn\'t let up in it\'s difficulty. It hands you all of these weapons and ways to ruin enemies and it KNOWS you can, so it tries everything and anything to beat you down. The combat is so fluid and responsive, stringing together combos and strings from one enemy to the next and the music is extremely good. There were moments where I felt like things didn\'t belong, specifically the a handful of enemies. Those red phoenix looking bird enemies, those angel monsters with scythes that phase through walls are terrible to deal with, and worst of all these light blue tentacle monsters with purple fumes radiating from them. All enemies I feel like shouldn\'t just be in this game at all cause they suck to deal with a lot, they all go against the core combat taught in this game and whenever I saw any of these enemies I let out a giant groan. But man, I thought MGS4 had one of the best final bosses in video gaming, this game is like on the same level of spectacle and perfection with IT\'S final boss. Probably the most brutal boss I\'ve ever fought in my life, genuinely. But my god It felt like an honest to god duel with another "human". I didn\'t think I would end up liking this game because I hardly ever play action games other than Bayonetta (and even then I didn\'t beat that one), and Metal Gear Rising. My third DMC game in and I\'m excited to what\'s next, hopefully no DMC2 shit. All I\'m hoping is that the game is a little less difficult cause fucking god this game took me 20 hours to beat. Near perfect, might grow on me more. +0.5 because Dante and Virgil\'s Devil Trigger designs were designed by Kazuma Kaneko, the illustrator for every Megaten game up until Persona 3 (I think). And finally, everyone who likes this game needs a serious evaluation on their mental health because the Stockholm Syndrome is very prevalent in you guys.. and me.', 'Jvais lfaire', 'Last fight with Virgil is too painful to beat. Nearly Impossible for me, so I dropped the game.', "One of the hardest games ive ever played and it's peak (NOT STOCKHOLM SYNDROME) This is the best hack and slash game ever made hands down‚Ä¶ The combat in this game feels amazing and so fluid, every death felt like I learned something new about the enemy and it was so rewarding to see my efforts realized in real time. The game also serves as an amazing prequel to the entire series. The lack of hand holding may turn the average player off‚Ä¶ But for me this is a sweet spot and is the shining example of what a difficult video game should be. Highly recommend.", 'where boy became men boyz 2 men boy meets world beau is afraid', "spite is such a powerful tool, Hideaki Itsuno directed arguably the best action game ever made purely because he didn't wanna go down in history as the DMC2 guy"]

Title: Norco
Summary: Norco is a Southern Gothic point & click narrative adventure that immerses the player in the sinking suburbs and verdant industrial swamps of a distorted South Louisiana. Your brother Blake has gone missing in the aftermath of your mother's death. In the hopes of finding him, you must follow a fugitive security android through the refineries, strip malls, and drainage ditches of suburban New Orleans.
Reviews: ["Amazingly well crafted story which has brought me back to point and click adventure games with more interest than before. I'd compare it in structure and feel to something like Kentucky route zero especially towards the climax of the narrative. Just a great sci-fi experience worth playing.", 'This is serious now, this is', 'most uneventful day in new orleans', 'A beautifully told, frequently funny, often overwrought, always thought-provoking, incomplete yet unforgettable little story.', 'Norco is a peculiar game, with a good art direction expressed through not very detailed pixel art.', "one of the most beautiful fever dreams you'll ever experience"]

Title: No More Heroes III

The latest numbered entry in the No More Heroes series.
             

              Fight your way to the top of the Galactic Superhero Rankings!
              
              The legendary assassin Travis Touchdown makes his glorious return to the Madness in the No More Heroes 3 game, exclusively on the Nintendo Switch system!

["So rushed... Could have been so much more with more time and a budget... It's no more heroes though... I guess", "Fuck this game, it sucks. The entry fees are back, the story sucks and its filled with bugs. I despise no more heroes 3, it is one of the worst open world games I've ever played. I don't care about the people that say that it's made with Suda51's style, mediocrity is not a style, laziness is not a style, this game is below what's acceptable and I hate it... i like the talking cat tho.", 'great game but i do kinda wish they added more bosses not just got back to nmh1 10 bosses intend of nmh2 15 bosses but still its a great game', "first time i've been hyped for chores", 'esse jogo tem o melhor travis touchdown da franquia
                     
                     apesar de seus defeitos como um mundo aberto vazio, eu n√£o consigo n√£o gostar do mundo aberto e n√£o consigo achar esse jogo genial e divertido
                     
                     √© o jogo mais divertido e mais bem feito da franquia al√©m de ser o mais insano e engra√ßado
                     
                     e o FU √© um dos meus vil√µes favoritos do jogo, de n√£o for o favorito', 'Termin√© NMH 3 en 1 d√≠a y con eso ya se pueden hacer una idea de lo tanto que ame este juego...']

Title: Mario Kart 64
Summary: Mario Kart 64 is the second main installment of the Mario Kart series. It is the first game in the series to use three-dimensional graphics, however, the characters and items in this game are still two-dimensional, pre-rendered sprites. The game offers two camera angles and three engine sizes: 50cc, 100cc and 150cc. Each kart has distinctive handling, acceleration and top speed capabilities. Shells that you fire at rival racers, Bananas that make them skid out and Lightning Bolts that make them small and very slow are just a few of the game's unique power-ups.
Reviews: ['diddy kong racing clears this hunk of shit. pretty alright tho', 'Still a ton of fun to play and always a hit at parties', 'Lots of great childhood memories with this one. Huge improvement on the SNES version. Still janky controls though haha.', 'A classic', 'Not sure why people prefer this when compared to the original. The controls are the worst out of the whole series. With even more bullshit falling off ledges and spinning out than the SNES original.', 'No Waluigi but still pretty fun.']

Title: Kirby and the Forgotten Land
Summary: Join Kirby in an unforgettable journey through a mysterious world in a delightful 3D platforming adventure. Take control of the powerful pink puffball, Kirby, and move around freely in 3D stages as you discover a mysterious world with abandoned structures from a past civilization - like a shopping mall?! Copy enemies‚Äô abilities like Sword and Ice and use them to attack and explore your surroundings! What journey awaits Kirby? Take a deep breath and get ready for an unforgettable adventure!
Reviews: ['It gaslights you into think the rest of the series is as competent and excellent as this one.', 'We all have a game where we just...disconnect our brain, just to get transported into a confortable and charming universe, carried by a easy, and yet endearing gameplay and a cosy experience', 'i wish it was longer bro, the game deserved dlc at least', 'Why is this games combat so good?', "This has got to be one of the most solid, high quality 3D platformers ever created. And it's HAL's first one?!", 'Inhaling an 18 wheeler and piloting it up crumbling metropolitan edifices so I can crash it into a biogenetically engineered god at the center of a black hole is the most fun I‚Äôve ever had on a Tuesday morning.']

Title: Half-Life 2: Episode One
Summary: Episode One is the first in a series of games that reveal the aftermath of Half-Life 2 and launch a journey beyond City 17.
Reviews: ['One of the best!', "It's fine.", 'Its ok', 'No puede ser malo si es un half life, pero efectivamente es el mas malo de los hl', 'Gostei, boa continua√ß√£o.', "HL is losing steam at this point but it's at least still trying to hang on, with the squad feature which is, idk, there, and the one free bullet achievement is actually quite fun to do, even on first tries - really shows how well the physics work."]

Title: Sonic Frontiers
Summary:
Worlds will collide in Sonic the Hedgehog‚Äôs newest adventure.
             

              An experience like never before, accelerate to new heights and experience the thrill of high velocity open-zone freedom. Battle powerful enemies as you speed through the Starfall Islands - landscapes brimming with dense forests, overflowing waterfalls, sizzling deserts and more!
Reviews: ["I've been trying SO hard to resist... The unfinished game will be finished by the end of the year... I have to wait to review it... BUT I CAN'T RESIST YELLING ABOUT HOW THE BOSS FIGHTS IN THIS GAME ARE PEEEEEAAAAAKKKKK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!", 'DO NOT HELP BIG THE CAT, HE MAKES YOU OVERPOWERED!!!', "I liked it at first because I get to move in a direction besides forward, it actually lasted longer than 3 hours, it looks like it would be pure Sonic gameplay from start to finish with no strings attached, it's essentially exactly what I was saying they needed to do after Forces right down to a tea. But the amount of issues I had with this game just kept piling up and piling up until it eventually became a death by a million cuts situation. Unlike Sonic '06 where it's just blatantly a broken piece of shit or Sonic Forces which is total laziness and next to nothing going for it.", 'Excerpts of various tweets as I played the game:', "The controls are shit, the plot was disappointing and normally i wouldn't care about the plot of a sonic game but i had some expectation considering this was written by the dude that wrote the decent IDW comics", 'A fun open-world Sonic game! Who could have guessed? Fun movement and creative ideas, but you can see where some corners were cut.']

Title: Mario Kart 8
Summary: Turn your racing experience upside down! Nintendo‚Äôs Mario Kart franchise comes to the Wii U console in full HD, introducing new racing circuit designs and anti-gravity karts that will have players driving upside down. And for the first time, all of Bowser‚Äôs seven Koopalings are playable characters-- get a taste of being bad on the race track by playing as Iggy, Larry, Lemmy, Ludwig, Morton, Roy and Wendy. Players will also enjoy a variety of series-favorite features, including the return of 12-player online competitive play, hang-gliders, underwater racing and motorbikes.
Reviews:
["It's like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe but worse", 'I liked having a new and fresh mario kart game for my wiiu. but it didnt have any exicting new features. Instead it had a terribe battle mode.', 'Pretty good Mario Kart game, soild presentation, graphic, ost, da works.', 'wall riding escapades', 'Gameplay - 10
                     
                     Trilha Sonora - 9
                     
                     Gr√°ficos - 10
                     
                     Hist√≥ria/Campanha - 8', 'O melhor Mario Kart da franquia, na minha opini√£o. S√≥ ficou meio b√°sico depois do lan√ßamento do Deluxe.']

Title: Final Fantasy XIV Online
Summary:
Take part in an epic and ever-changing Final Fantasy as you adventure and explore with friends from around the world. Final Fantasy XIV Online is the 2013 relaunch of the massively multiplayer online role-playing game that takes the wonder of the FF legacy and expands it, allowing you to explore the realm of Eorzea like never before in a Final Fantasy game.
             

              Forge friendships, mount chocobos, and board airships as you and your companions create your own unique stories in Eorzea. Adventure alone or join up with friends to undertake epic quests, battle familiar Final Fantasy monsters, and acquire unique abilities and equipment. All the classic elements from the series that you have come to know and love are waiting! Embark of the adventure of a lifetime to help reforge the fate of Eorzea!
Reviews: ['ARR is definitely the weakest of all expacs, but is well worth playing because of how amazing the other expacs are', 'Up to date so i guess that counts as completed?', 'My favourite game of all time. So much content, incredibly fun solo or with friends.', 'As a whole I loved it. ARR story is weak but it gets better as you progress through the expansions. Lots to love about this, so many things to do. Huge world.', "not an MMO person but I liked this more than the others I've tried (it has catboys)", 'When the fuck does this game get good']

Title: Batman: Arkham Origins
Summary: Batman: Arkham Origins features an expanded Gotham City and introduces an original prequel storyline occurring several years before the events of Batman: Arkham Asylum and Batman: Arkham City.
Reviews:
["The most underrated game, sadly. I don't know why??? The Pre-Rendered cutscenes were iconic, it used the same engine as Arkham City, the Map is like a boost of the last one.", 'If this was a year ago I would have given this a 3 or 3.5 easy. Not the best of gameplays, but a cool story and solid base for a game that was rushed. And while I still like the story and respect that this game was finished at all with its tight deadline, it was way more janky to play than I remembered when I had my last playthrough shortly before the release of The Batman. Just a lot of odd choices being made for a prequel.', 'Brain Trauma Simulator -1', "Never thought I'd see glue as an ice substitute", 'My first Arkham game was Asylum and I enjoyed that game for what it was. I was intrigued how they could translate that into the open world format and honestly they seem to have done it quite well in my books. It's pretty freeing to glide around and grapple anywhere in Gotham. There are a lot of collectibles and busy work I skipped on but I did some side quests which were actually really great and didnt feel lazy and copy and pasted. Within the open world is the main quest which basically felt the same as Arkham Asylums gameplay with linear level design with a focus on using gadgets to progress, stealth encounters and combat. All of which were balanced pretty perfectly. The combat isnt super deep but it was satisfying. The only thing Asylum has over this game is the story and tone. This games story just wasnt that good in my opinion, part of it was Batmans voice actor change which I wasnt a big fan of due to it sounding "forced" if I can describe it but also his characterisation. And some plotpoints that confused me like Bane entering the bat lair, causing the tiniest, miniscule amount of damage and leaving without a word. Not even leaking Bruce' identity anywhere before he forgets his identity. The plot could've been better but it was
                     
                      serviceable

Title: Zero Escape: Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors
Summary:
The first game in the Zero Escape series, originally made as a standalone title "Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors". The Zero Escape rebranding and alternative cover of the game were released around the time of the Sequel "Zero Escape: Virtue's Last Reward".
             

              The game is a murder mystery visual novel with a heavy story focus that requires multiple playthroughs to figure out and involves puzzle rooms used to progress through the story with dialogue choices to be made inbetween them.
             

              The iOS version of the game removed the puzzle rooms to focus more on the visual novel aspects of the game. The puzzle rooms are replaced with narration of the events that take place instead. The iOS version of the game also has an exclusive ending.

Title: Baba is You
Summary: Baba Is You is a puzzle game where you can change the rules by which you play. In every level, the rules themselves are present as blocks you can interact with; by manipulating them, you can change how the level works and cause surprising, unexpected interactions! With some simple block-pushing you can turn yourself into a rock, turn patches of grass into dangerously hot obstacles, and even change the goal you need to reach to something entirely different.

Title: Watch Dogs
Summary: Set in Chicago, where a central network of computers connects everyone and everything, Watch Dogs explores the impact of technology within our society. Using the city as your weapon, you will embark on a personal mission to inflict your own brand of justice. Title: Drakengard
Summary:
Drakengard follows the story of a kingdomless prince named Caim who fights for the Union against the Empire. Under the Union's protection are the Hierarchs and the Goddess, currently Caim's sister Furiae, who is a human manifestation of one of the four seals that protect the world from being broken. As the game begins, Cain is fatally wounded in a battle with the Empire. Encountering a captured Red Dragon who is also near death, Caim makes a fateful choice. In exchange for both their lives, the Red Dragon and Caim will enter a pact. This pact will forever chain their lives to one another and link their souls, at the cost of something irreplaceable. Recharged with the fires of a Dragon, Caim's vengeance burns over the enemy...
             

              The player controls Caim on his quest. The game is separated into three distinct modes: Aerial combat, Ground combat and Event Combat. In Aerial Combat, Caim rides dragonback against a variety of airborne foes breathing fireballs (strong single shots and weaker multiple lock-on shots). The Dragon is agile and is able to evade incoming threats, turning around completely in a moment. In Ground combat, the game is shown in 3rd person though usually large, open areas. Controlling Caim, his primary ability is the use of a variety of weapons found on the battlefield. These are leveled up through continued usage, and specifically through the killing of individual enemies. Though magic (determined by weapon choice), timed attacks and evasion, Caim breaks through enemy armies. Characters recruited as allies by Caim can also be summoned during battles, steadily losing health until control is returned to Caim. In ground combat, Caim may also call forth his Dragon to ride and strafe enemies from the air. The Dragon's movements are generally the same as in aerial combat but more limited and less agile. Event combat is similar to Ground combat, but shown isometrically, restricted to a single weapon and without the aid of a dragon. It is used mainly to tell story sequences.
             

              Levels that have been visited before might become "Expedition Missions" which are optional and contain new objectives, enemies and weapons. Additionally, any level previously played in the storyline may be revisited at any time. Depending on Caim's choices (and prerequisites for those choices), there are five different endings to Drakengard.

Title: LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga
Summary:
Play through a fun Star Wars galaxy that combines the endless customization of LEGO with the epic story from all six episodes of Star Wars. This is the definitive LEGO Star Wars comprising the first two games and expanding them with new characters, enhanced visuals, and more bonus levels than you can shake a lightsaber at.
             

              LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga is a family-friendly game, which is both funny and challenging. Pick and choose your characters wisely to engage in combat, solve puzzles and work together as a team to defeat the dark side.
Reviews: ["this was always my favorite lego game, and i've played a few. it's just fucking good", 'One of the best LEGO games, but not THE best...also one of the best Star Wars games, but not THE best.', 'This game is silly but fun to break all the things and collect studs', 'This is without a doubt the best way to experience Star Wars as a video game and I am not joking. No other Star Wars game comes close to the level of polish this game has. There is an insane amount to collect and it explore before finally getting 100%. Rarely do you see a game nowadays come with a completion % display in the hub world. Collectathon fans and Star Wars fans (high crossover rate there) should play this game to the fullest. Mechanically simple and smooth to boot, but rarely has its disinteresting moments. EXCEPT FOR GUNSHIP CAVALRY IN EPISODE 2, WORST LEVEL IN THE ENTIRE GAME', 'LEGO Star Wars The Complete Saga is, without a doubt, my favorite LEGO game until this day.', 'Best Lego game.']

Title: The Last of Us Part II
Summary: The Last of Us Part II is an action-adventure game set five years after the events of The Last of Us. The player traverses post-apocalyptic environments such as buildings and forests to advance the story. He can use firearms, improvised weapons, and stealth to defend against hostile humans and cannibalistic creatures infected by a mutated strain of the Cordyceps fungus. The game intermittently switches control between Ellie and Abby, and also briefly Joel in the opening sequence. The nimble nature of the player character introduces platforming elements, allowing the player to jump and climb to traverse environments and gain advantages during combat.
Reviews: ['I... have never been so devastated after finishing a game. Needless to say, the game played is fantastic and the story is absolutely amazing.', "Also never personally played this, but I am definitely familiar with it. After spending the entire first game with Joel, Ellie's journey is so powerful. The player feels in one with how Ellie is feeling. When the shift to Abby happens, it becomes an entirely different game. Up to that point of the games, the story has been solely and entirely about Joel and Ellie. Outside characters came and went as they joined and left the Joel and Ellie universe, but now the experience was from the complete opposite perspective. The dozens of people Ellie killed became real, and both Ellie and the player have to decide how they will deal with this realization. good stuff.", 'At least once a month I start typing up an essay for this game to publish to Backloggd, realize "Wait, why am I wasting my time typing something of substance for Backloggd," then will go about my merry way. So instead of an essay, I\'ll just give a few bullet points on why The Last of Us Part II is a piece of shit game:', 'A beautifully haunting depiction of the irrationality, guilt, and self-destruction associated with grief.', 'Crying', "Although I wasn't happy with the story. It still was an incredible expirience."]

Title: Judgment
Summary: Judgment is an action-adventure game played from a third-person perspective. The game is a legal thriller set in the Yakuza world of Kamurocho and follows private detective Takayuki Yagami as he investigates a serial murder case. It stars Japanese actor Takuya Kimura and employs a fighting system similar to that of Yakuza 0 where players can change into different styles, namely crane-style which is more focused on fighting groups and tiger-style which is more focused on fighting individuals. Additionally, the game features an investigation mode where the player must find traces of the criminal.
Reviews: ['for higashi only (all jokes aside, the combat felt fucky but i was just glad to have gotten it done)', "Nothing could've prepared me for what this game delivered. Going into this I thought it would be a nice addition to the universe but get tiresome after the first few chapters. Having said that, I was absolutely blown away by everything this game delivered. I think the most important thing to know when playing this is that this is NOT a Yakuza game. Sure it has the same core gameplay loop but it's vastly different in terms of storytelling and actually tying the gameplay to the other aspects of the game. Instead of focusing on characters (which this game still does, just not to the extent of other RGG titles) it built an incredible story which just continues to get tighter and more thrilling as the chapters fly by. The side content is some of the best from the entire series and considering that I'm talking about RGG games, that means a lot to me. The side cases and friend quest thingies are mostly outstanding and just really add to the unique feel of Judgement's Kamurocho. Yagami and Kaito are incredibly loveable and special characters that quickly gained a place in my heart. I really believe they are some of the best main characters RGG has created thus far. My only actual nitpick are the minigames which felt a bit bland. Also there was no karaoke so that definitely hurt me. As for the mechanics which get quite a bit of critique online (especially mortal wounds and the tailing missions) I didn't mind too much. Sure they did bother me at points but not to the extent where it would lower my enjoyment of the game. Overall just a must play game for any RGG fan or just fans of games with thrilling, gripping and lengthy crime drama stories.", 'not too far along here but god damn do i love everything in this universe', 'I love ace attorney', 'A detective that calls kamurocho home.', 'I bought this on a whim early last year when Steam had a big sale for several of their titles. Even still, it was lying in my Steam library, untouched for several months before I decide on a whim to suddenly play it last week. And before I know it, two hours have passed.']

Title: A Plague Tale: Requiem
Summary: A Plague Tale: Requiem is an action-adventure game similar to its predecessor. The player assumes control of Amicia and must face against both soldiers from the French Inquisition and hordes of rats that are spreading the black plague. Gameplay is largely similar to the first game, though the combat system is significantly expanded. The game features a progression system in which the player will be awarded additional skills and abilities. Stealth players will unlock skills that allow them to sneak around more efficiently, while those who prefer a more lethal approach will unlock additional combat skills. Locations are also larger, giving players additional options to progress.
Reviews: ["Man, what a journey.\n                     \n                     It definitely dragged on in some chapters, specially in the first half, but the second half was so packed with emotional gut punches and some of the most horrific scenery I've ever seen in any media.", 'A must-play for anyone who appreciates stunning visuals and immersive sound design. While it may have some minor flaws in terms of gameplay or plot, the overall experience is one that is both beautiful and haunting, and is sure to leave a lasting impression.', 'A non-perfect title, certainly overshadowed by a gameplay that may not be exceptional, but which strikes straight to the heart and which I will hardly forget. Obviously highly recommended to Innocence lovers and to those who appreciate linear titles with an intriguing and well-narrated plot.', "I hate stealth games. Most of the time I find them tense, tedious and just unenjoyable. However, I played the first Plague Tale through because it was leaving Game Pass last year and a friend told me I should check it out. I'm so glad that I did because it was such a great experience!", 'A Plague tale innocence was good, and requiem here is good too but it feels like it should be better where as Innocence was a surprise hit. The graphical fidelity and detail here is very high in the sequel not that the first game was by any means ugly in comparison but the changes in scenery and colour on display in this entry are strong. What isn\'t as strong is the structure and puzzles which I was expecting to be more complex and fitting. I think the general premise is great but I was hoping for a lot more in the way of puzzles relating to Amicias sling (which remain as simple as in Innocence), and newer additions like the crossbow. Especially in combat which in the early stages alludes to a concept that should\'ve been explored a lot further something akin to a morality system like in Dishonoured as an example. Here it\'s a narrative tool and discarded as quickly as it\'s brought up but used to hold characters accountable loosely even in the later acts of the game. It\'s a game with great potential to go further in terms of gameplay still, but the story itself has in my opinion pigeonholed itself in regards to what transpire with the De Rune family, and I think more room was needed to explore in a future title. It\'s much the same as the first entry in terms of gameplay with the odd addition in places but nothing new sticks as well as the crossbow which is almost too good I think for the gameplay feel they were going for in the first entry to here. Some iffy dialogue and less engaging puzzles mainly bring the game down but also the structure around everything. It essentially repeats it\'s own first act with a new coat of paint and different (and more interesting) characters. This would be fine but a lot of the tension that came with the first games isolation of Amicia and Hugo at times is lost here though this is replaced with a more "complex" cast of villain/s at play than just being purely insidious monsters. I hope for a future release under the franchise with much more varied puzzles and better utilisation of the combat narratively but it works as a good sequel in the end to what was already a good game albeit less surprising and punchy.', 'A total improvement from the first game. Good mechanics and great closing for this story.']
